Oops, my ISP seems to have changed their version of Lynx, which I use
to generate the calendar.  Thus the footnoted links, and maybe other
formatting changes.  Anyway, Deep and One World look pretty good for
Friday, then there's a buncha stuff on Saturday - check them all out;
then finally there's a freebie on Sunday in Berkeley.



                              The SFR Calendar
                                      
           http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi
     _________________________________________________________________
   
               Upcoming Parties in the San Francisco Bay Area
                                      
   Friday, December 5th - [1]Deep
   deep/progressive house, techno, etc.
   Forest Green, Monty, BioJeff.
   First Friday of each month.
   9pm-2am, 21+, $3. Il Pirata, 2007 16th St @ Potrero, SF.
   
   Friday, December 5th - One World
   Rockin' on til the breaka breaka dawn!
   Grev-V, Laird, Mark Grant (Cajual/Chicago), DJ Doubt, Laron.
   11pm-6am, 21+, $12. 174 King St, SF. 415.273.1170
   
   Saturday, December 6th - Togetha presents Fun For Kids
   a Christmas toy drive for less fortunate children in Sacramento.
   Rick Preston, Matt G, Flash, Markus, J.P., John Michael, DJ Dennis,
   Mike Moss, Jus'tom, DJ Sol.
   Free with packaged toy donation
   Sacramento. 916.484.3791
   
   Saturday, December 6th - Light-Bright
   Brad & Brian (Moontribe, LA), Mike (F-8), Nylsin, Kamia.
   This will be a very special party in the Santa Cruz area.
   408.460.0676
   
   Saturday, December 6th - Oblivion Productions presents [2]Sugar
   Deep, Progressive House
   Jay-J, Chip McClure, Lewis, Ellen Ferrato.
   9pm-3am, 21+, $5. the Stud, 399 9th St @ Harrison, SF.
   
   Saturday, December 6th - Eeyore's Party
   Vincent (Parallel Recordings), Thermal, Dreams without Numbers
   (Silent), Discorporate (Sebsi vs. Heatshield), pH Synkro.
   Visuals by Donovan.
   415.339.8123
   
   Saturday, December 6th - Fat Boys presents Havin' it Large
   European progressive house
   Phat Pat (London UK), Keith O'Reilly (Dublin/Ireland), Seth (SF).
   Visuals by 'artists who kill'.
   9:30pm-2am, 21+. (over South Beach Billiards), 270 Brannan St between
   1st & 2nd, SF. 415.289.6686

                             Radio/TV/Net Shows
                                      
     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)
     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night midnight-1am - "Shortwave" - Electronic music in all
       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night 9pm-11pm - free form music mix. KPFA 94.1
       (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning - "the tube" hosted by miss laura
       aka lola. an electronic excursion into ambient soundscapes,
       ethereal trance, and washes of other whimsical muzik. KAZU 90.3
       (Monterey Bay Community Radio)
     * Thursday morning 10am-2pm - "The Further Adventures of Aardvark" -
       trip-hop to experimental to ambient to gabba etc, etc. [25]KSJS
       90.5 (San Jose).
     * Thursday 5pm-9pm - [26]The Beta Lounge - Live netcast of jungle,
       dub, breakbeat, hiphop, ambient, experimental.
       [27]http://www.betalounge.com/
     * Thursday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. The
       best in beats to satiate your inner child. Electronic dance,
       noise, spoken word, world music and more. Also available in
       RealAudio. KZSU 90.1 (Stanford)
     * Friday 10am-3pm - weekly DJ netcasts. [28]x-radio.
     * Friday 3pm-6pm - free form music mix. [29]KUSF 90.3 (SF) (also
       available on [30]Realaudio
     * Friday 9:30am-noon - Snappy the Aligator plays deep groove music
       that dips into cool electronic sounds, classic soul, reggae &
       more. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on
       [31]KUSF 90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Jungle, Detroit, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, and
       noise [32]KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, [33]KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - [34]"Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs
       from SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. [35]KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night 9pm-mid - "Underbrush" w/[36]DJ Radon and guests -
       Beats, Breakz and Buzz KZSU 90.1 (Stanford). Also broadcast via
       RealAudio.
     * Saturday night 11pm - [37]Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. [38]flux@flux.net
     * (every other) Saturday night 10p-12:30a - "1984" w/DJ Richtoffen.
       House, Trance and German rave. 90.1 (Chico)
     * Saturday night - "amp" 1am. [39]MTV.
     * Saturday night - "Subsonic". 1am-6am, [40]KITS 105.3 SF.
     * Saturday night - "House Nation" w/"Anthems Mix", Top 10s from
       guest DJs and "London Connection w/DJ Doubt". 2am-4am, WILD 94.9
       SF.
     * Ambiance Magazine - 9:30p weds-sun PNC Cable 2 (Modesto &
       Oakdale), 9p fri & sat, marcus cable ch 9 (ceres & turlock).

                            Administrative Notes
                                      
   If anyone has info on any other events, [42]send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   [43]majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to [44]majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
    [45]Derek Chung - [46]dhchung@hyperreal.org

Date: Thu, 4 Dec 1997 18:35:59 -0800 (PST)
From: Messiah Wannabe <messiahw@rocketmail.com>
Subject: sex+raving=one helluva party
To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk




ok i'm gonna go out on a limb here.  but heck, i spend so much time on
this here limb i probably oughta go ahead and build myself a
treehouse...

so, what i want to know is, what's so bad about watching people having
sex?  i kinda like it.  i mean, don't get me wrong, i don't sneak
around peeping in peoples windows or anything.  nor am i a lifetime
member of the royal dyonesian swingers club or anything like that. 
and certainly everybody is entitled to their own tastes, preferences
and opinions.  but as for myself, i don't really see why people would
get all worked up about a little hanky panky goin down in some
secluded corner of the chill room.  as far as i'm concerned it just
adds to the vibe.  hell, to be completely honest, if were to look up
and see some fine raver couple buck naked goin' at it on top of the
speaker stack, i'd probably just think "damn, this is one helluva
party..."

-messiah wannabe

TeKnODiVa wrote:

> that never used to be.  Does anyone else notice this??  IS is
possible that
> ravers have their own jargon?? Or have I just picked up a few words
here and
> there over the course of this year?? 

i think ravers definitely have their own language, or jargon at least.
 my impression is that ravespeak, around here anyway, is a mixture of
west coast hip hop slang and present day valley girl/boy (ie. "hella"
as opposed to "gag me with a spoon"), much like beatnik jive was
californian hipsters' take on black jazzspeak.

here's an idea: i think us sfravers should come up with our own
jargon.  i mean, the first people on the block to use that new hip
slang word always get cool points right?  but if you try to make up
your own words, people just think you're dumb.  until, that is, they
start hearing everyone else using them, and realize you're just way
more ahead of the curve than they are.  so if we all agree to start
using the same words at the same time, maybe other ravers will pick
them up.  and we'll all be guaranteed to be the first one's droppin 'em.

here's one suggestion:

blowin' speakers - extreme drug experience ("try the tabs that guy
painted silver is selling.  shits blowin my speakers.")


-messiah w


ps did i just make that up, or did i overhear it, and then
subconciously dredge it up from my foggy memory and claim to have
thought of it myself?

From: SolR <solr@sacraves.org>
Subject: Seattle Thanksgiving Review
In-Reply-To: <348666A9.5D6CF50E@citiscape.com>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk



Well, I split on Thursday...met up with my Dad, little sisters [22,10], and
my  ex-step-mother for morning bagel, multiple-espressos and a valium.  I
had been a crab-ass most of the morning, but my step-mom's valium  put me
in check.  The plane left at 12:05..and we were off.  

My sister [22] and I were the last two on the plane[96,97], we sat all the
way in the back next to the attendant's little cubicle.  Our attendant,
Tim, was a crackup... hitting on a blonde midway in his section during the
saftey brief by clicking the seatbelt together with a wink and a smile...

After making my sister a One Eyed Mary instead of a Gin Mary, and spilling
said Gin Mary on my pants [after my littlest sister had spilled mocha on
them], he set us up with multiples throughout the hour and 45 min ride...
needless to say, we were bombed by the time we arrived.

Our friend, Danielle Montrose [5'1" and a bundle of raver energy], met us
at the airport, and we began our trek back to the place she was
house-sitting... the home of two strippers who were away in Las Vegas to
make money for rent.  One had an georgeous female pitbull named Raven...
she was a sweet-but-pushy little bitch.

My sister is from Reno [attending UNR], as well as two other house guests,
Becky, and Shawn... who were both from Reno, and were both Dj's.  Shawn was
a promoter as well...  Friday we all went out vintage clothes shopping, all
finding *something* to spend money on.  Our tour guide, Vanessa [Danielle
had only been there 3 months], was a promoter, and [with some other close
friends] had just opened up Club FX... So, she put us on the list, and we
had a phat fun filled night dancing there. Caught Little T [haven't I read
a couple mails about her?].. The E was KILLER! Phat section downstairs, as
well as upstairs... coat check... they haven't even started setting that
place up either... soooo much  potential.

Saturday, we woke up late... that eve, we went out to Vinylized, danced
there most of the night.. there was a fight downstairs that kept me up with
the housey stuff upstairs... breaker circles suck in close quarters, I need
some *room*, but there was this one girl who was goin' OFF! The vibe was a
bit off for most of the eve there, I imagine it had something to do with
the fight... on our way out to Area 51 pretty early in the morning, there
was som PHAT jungle in the downstairs... we had to stop and shake it for a
bit... the floor was empty, and the vibe was shite in the rest of the room,
so we split.

Over to Area 51, where, ohmigosh, there was Vanessa! Right up front givin'
a little shake to a Dj that was on a lineup for a Valentine's party she and
her crew were putting on... [cant remember his name.... Mike?MAD props
though] another METHED-OUT english/scottish Dj, who was tweakin' the vinyl
like he was tweakin' his face..., phat groove though, just before.. um,
mike.. there was another kickin' set... needless to say, I kept it up as
long as I could, my right leg was DEAD, my feet were numb, but still
managed to get funky a couple of times towards the end... we were so
cracked, we decided *not* to go to the CatWalk, which opened up at 10am or
so...

Sunday, we headed up to Vancouver.. wanted to get  in some of the night
life, but wasn't sure if I could hang after the last two nights... Spent
the late afternoon cruising around, just checking the sights.. met a little
girl named Kili in a foriegn country, on the corner of downtown Vancouver
[4 of us huddled around a map], she asked.. "um, can I help you find
something...?" my sister responded.. "yea, we're..." I interupted, "you
could really help us out by telling us what we *should* find, and where we
*should* go."  She then proceeded to tell us just about every tourist
attraction we should hit on our short trip.. including where the Spagetti
Factory was on Water St so we could get a reasonably priced dinner... She
was an angel.

Missed our 9:50 flight... so we went to a mall, and I got my hair cut/done
at a spanish-french salon... [for those of you who have seen my
long-hairedness.., you're in for a shocker when next we meet]. Caught the
3:00, last two again [122,123] we got a  bit of a buzz on [oh, crater lake
as pretty as a picture on the way up... Mt. Everest, Rainier, and St.
Helens on the way  back... oh, man... what can I say... beautiful] during
the ride back... a bit more crowded...

Bit of rain.. overcast.. wet, windy, and cold.. I LOVED IT! Can't wait to
go back late  this month or latest, January. Kim, I love your city.

Peace,
-SolR

  oooh! Scary!






Forwarded for your amusement:

The real name of Bill Gates is William Henry Gates III.

Nowadays he is known as Bill Gates.

By converting the letters of his current name to the ASCII-values and
adding his "3" (III), you get the following:

                            B       66
                            I       73
                            L       76
                            L       76
                            G       71
                            A       65
                            T       84
                            E       69
                            S       83
                            I        1
                            I        1
                            I        1
                            ----------
                               666!

Some might ask, "How did Bill Gates get so powerful?" Coincidence? Or
just the beginning of mankind's  ultimate and total enslavement???

Before you decide, consider the following:

M  S  -  D  O  S     6  .  2  1

77+83+45+68+79+83+32+54+46+50+49= 666

W  I  N  D  O  W  S  9  5

87+73+78+68+79+87+83+57+53+1 =  666

Coincidence?  You decide.




From sfraves-owner-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Fri Dec 05 07:17:57 1997

Hi all!  ]=}

 THC (the active ingredient tested for in urine tests) builds up in the 
fatty tisues over time. A personal amount in the urine would depend 
on *overall* use over the past mounth or so and how much body fat the 
person averaged (ectomorphs get off easy as they have almost no fat).

 Typically what one wants to do is to drink lots of fluids (water, 
cranberry juice--at least a gallon a day), especially 24 hours prior to 
testing. Take a B-complex vitamin two hours before  testing to yellow up 
your urine and possibly contaminate the test. I've also used Golden Seal 
powder in capsules. Passed the test after getting stoney for the first 
time in a while at Freaky People.

 Keep in mind this is very unprofessional advice and you use it at your 
own risk.  ;)

------- Forwarded Message

Date: Thu, 4 Dec 1997 22:28:21 -0800 (PST)
From: "David C. Kwan" <kwan@mills.edu>
Reply-To: "David C. Kwan" <kwan@mills.edu>
To: nm-list@xmission.com
Subject: OPUS415 No.3 New Music Marathon on Sunday 12/7

The Common Sense Composers' Collective Presents

OPUS415  No. 3
Bay Area New Music Marathon

Sunday, December 7, 1997  
1:00 PM - 11:00 PM
at
The ODC Performance Gallery
3153 Seventeenth St.
San Francisco, CA
All Day Pass $15, $10 Students/Seniors 


The Common Sense Composers' Collective presents OPUS415 No.3, the 3rd Annual
Bay Area New Music Marathon.

OPUS415 No.3 will feature over 25 Bay Area composers, including special guest
Terry Riley, Charles Amirkhanian, Brenda Hutchinson, Miya Masaoka, Paul
Dresher, and Maggi Payne in a diverse mix of works that bridge the gap
between the streets and the university.  The marathon's 10 hours of music
will range from unconstrained improvisation to elaborately notated scores,
and represents both emerging and established artists.  This year's Marathon
will have a special emphasis on "Music & Image" and will feature our
house-band, Nik Phelps and the Sprocket Ensemble, accompanying several
animated shorts throughout the day.

Come hear such dynamic performers as Terry Riley, Sarah Cahill, Randy Porter,
Pamela Z, Amy X Neuburg, The Stanford String Quartet, Music Now, American
Baroque, and Twisted Tutu (from NYC) performing on instruments ranging from
solo koto to multiple computers.

 
Questions?   Call Common Sense: 415/285-8680 or e-mail: DanJB@aol.com




MARATHON SCHEDULE:


12:30 PM          Pre-concert: Musical Illbience provided by Mr. Meridies
 

1:00 PM - 3:30 PM   SET ONE

Nik Phelps and the Sprocket Ensemble		Ideas In Animation
Miya Masaoka					New Work
Jonathan Berger					Jerusalem Songs
Butch Rovan & Zack Settel			Throttle
Paul Dresher					Blue Diamonds
Dan Joseph					Periodicity Piece #4
Amy X Neuburg & Herb Heinz			Twice as big as mine      


3:30 PM - 6:00 PM   SET TWO

Nik Phelps and the Sprocket Ensemble		Ideas In Animation
Thornhill Elementary School Improv Ensemble	Animal Legends
Christopher Tin					Amuse Yourself
Kotoka Suzuki					Minyo
Charles Amirkhanian				Composition No.1 for Solo 
						  Amplified Ratchet
D.C. Meckler					Stuck Piano One
Randy Nordschow					Seven Pages for Clarinet 
                                                  and Piano
Randy Porter					Racket Music


6:00 - 8:30 PM  SET THREE

Nik Phelps and the Sprocket Ensemble		Ideas In Animation
Pamela Z					Works
Hyo-shin Na					Variations
Vorticella					Improvisation
Maggi Payne					Apparent Horizon  
John A. Maurer IV				endzeitgefuehl     
Dan Becker				        HappyKat Eclipse


8:30 - 11:00 PM    SET FOUR

Terry Riley					Solo Piano
David Duret					Lollywagon
Micheline Roi					Of Breath and Touch
Belinda Reynolds				Between you and me
Jaroslaw Kapuscinski				Mondrian Variations

whoever was saying rude comments on my post about the age thing: CHILL. I was
merely stating that I dont know many other 15 year olds on this list, and that
age doesnt matter. whether you were joking or not, i took it seriously. I dont
think that the age of a person can be determined by a number, but rather the
experience that he/she has lived in his or her own life. I've gone through so
much shit in my 16 years of living that judging me on a number would be kind
of dumb. Just because some 16 year olds are immature, doesnt mean that ALL 16
year olds are immature. I know people well into their 20 who act WAY younger
than I do. So should I judge all 25 year olds by those 2 people? No. 
 
if you dont agree with what i'm saying and think its totally stupid, thank you
for at least taking the time to read it.

MarQ

--------------------

Roland Digital Group - 3D Machines


 Roland Digital Group adds to its line-up of CAMM-3
 machines a new concept in rapid prototyping or hobby
building. The PICZA 3D Scanner and the MODELA 3D
                    Plotter.

  

                                              



        

  
     The PICZA 3D
     Scanner
                   
                              The MODELA 3D
                              Plotter


          The PICZA 3D Scanner is an automatic
  piezo-electric scanning device used to capture any
 3-dimensional object from glass bottles to small ribbon
bows or even clay mock-ups. Once the object has been
 scanned, it can be scaled and reproduced in a variety of
 modeling materials with the MODELA 3D Plotter. The
PICZA and MODELA can be sold separately, but when
used as companion products they enable model builders,
    jewelry designers, woodworkers, toy and game
 designers, decorative craft artists, and home hobbyists
 to enter a virtual or real 3D world by exporting scanned
 files into VRML web page designs or producing actual
  physical prototypes of their customized designs. Both
   machines provide their own Windows95 software
  program. The PICZA ships with Dr. PICZA software
  and the MODELA ships with MODELA Player, 3D
  Design, and 3D Text software. The PICZA MSRP is
     $1495USD and the MODELA is $1195USD. 
                          

                         

  With PICZA, details are captured. With MODELA,
            concepts become reality.   
      If you want to bring your models to the real world,
 PICZA scans interface with the MODELA 3D Plotter
 seamlessly. The MODELA Player program is accessed
 directly through the Dr. PICZA software by the click of
   an icon. Convert your wireframe images to real 3D
 conceptual prototypes with the MODELA 3D Plotter in
  a variety of modeling materials including balsa wood,
 Styrofoam, foamboard, soft plastics, and modeling wax,
               just to name a few. 
                         
       The PICZA connects to your laptop or desktop
computer system through a serial (com port) connection
 while the MODELA connects to the computer through
   a parallel connection (lpt port). This allows for both
    machines to be connected to the same computer
simultaneously without the need for any switch boxes or
 continual reconnecting of one machine or the other. You
   can be scanning one project on the PICZA while
 producing a physical prototype of another project with
  the MODELA - - at the same time. All this can be
  accomplished completely unattended!   PICZA and
    MODELA. They take your designs into the next
                   dimension.

OKay sort of lame, but funny!  BILL IS EVIL!
> Forwarded for your amusement:
> 
> The real name of Bill Gates is William Henry Gates III.
> 
> Nowadays he is known as Bill Gates.
> 
> By converting the letters of his current name to the ASCII-values and
> adding his "3" (III), you get the following:
> 
>                             B       66
>                             I       73
>                             L       76
>                             L       76
>                             G       71
>                             A       65
>                             T       84
>                             E       69
>                             S       83
>                             I        1
>                             I        1
>                             I        1
>                             ----------
>                                666!
> 
> Some might ask, "How did Bill Gates get so powerful?" Coincidence? Or
> just the beginning of mankind's  ultimate and total enslavement???
> 
> Before you decide, consider the following:
> 
> M  S  -  D  O  S     6  .  2  1
> 
> 77+83+45+68+79+83+32+54+46+50+49= 666
> 
> W  I  N  D  O  W  S  9  5
> 
> 87+73+78+68+79+87+83+57+53+1 =  666
> 
> Coincidence?  You decide.
> 
> 
> 
>

Precedence: bulk

Actually the best way is to drink a lot of water and a diuretic of some
sort (beer, coffee, cranberry juice) the night before, to flush out
your system.  Then the day of the test, drink lots again, pee a few
times before the test, and take a B-complex vitamin, so your urine 
isn't all clear.  And if you can help it, don't give them the first
or last bit out of your bladder.  My . . . uh . . . friend did this
and passed a piss test the day after smoking down.

Might check the NORML site, too, as they may have some advice.

Cheers,
Steve.

--

http://www.compare.net/
Information is Power

******************************** TONIGHT
************************************
                         friday december 5th, 1997

                   s  t  i  r -  f  r  i  -  d  a  y

free lunch* at san francisco's best place for local and international cuisine
drum&bass + hip hop + house + dub + funk + rare grooves + soul + jazz + beatz

Tonights Menu:

starter:

Jason Fluid
Specially picked oolong experimental hip hop, baked in soul with a generous
helping of surprise treats to tease yo tongue...

entree:

Professor Smith  ( XLR8R )
Served on a bed of silver Technics noodles, lots of spiced drum'n'space
beats to make your head bop and make you yearn for more. At first glance
this dish is a tall order and may intimidate, but try something different
for once will ya...

dessert:

Maneesh the Twister
Some Indian flava in your ear... Baked and dubbed to perfection, this
dessert has been sought after for ages. So light and tasty, you'll be sure
to have seconds


Next week's menu includes Foo Young Steven Tune (Influx Sound System) in
Sizzling Atmospheric soup, served with combination drum'n'bass...

ALL OF THIS AND MORE CAN BE FOUND AT THE CITY'S PREMIER HAPPY HOUR FOR THE
      NEWEST EXPERIMENTAL DANCE MUSIC ON EARTH... STRI FRI-DAYS

             every fri-day @ the minna street gallery
    1 1 1  m i n n a ( btwn. mission / howard / new mont. / 2nd )
                      f r o m   5  to  9  p m

                  all you can eat ! and it's free !




* DISCLAIMER
( lunch not actually free, unless you're on a strict diet of great music ! )

silent records                          (name)@silent.org
340 bryant st.                          www.silent.org
3rd floor east                          415-957-1320
san francisco, ca 94107                 fax:957-0779

                         ***UPCOMING RELEASES***

Call Sang Hwang or Matt Valenzuela for more specifics...
Thanks to all the writers/reviewers for their continued support !

*VA-Big Shots                          SR9719     December 8    2X12"/CD
label: Silent / XLR8R Tracks
Silent Records is proud to announce the fourth offering from XLR8R
magazine's excellent label.   " Big Shots " is a milestone in the evolution
of American drum and bass, with a list of Bay Area artists ranging from
Sharp Scientific to Rec Orc, from DJ Abstract to High Steppers.  Learn the
sound that is emerging from the underground depths of San Francisco's drum
'n' bass community.




                       ***PAST AND CURRENT RELEASES***

*Westside Chemical - Phibsborough      SR9732      out now      CD
label: Silent / Domestic
The long awaited release from Domestic Recordings.  Westside Chemical are
preparing to take control of your mind an speakers with their unique brand
of drum and bass.  Slightly psychedelic, melodic, and definitely influenced
by a heavy dose of dub, theirs is a totally original vibe in a world full
of imitators and bandwagoneers.  Behold the new school of the San Francisco
underground.

*Astral Matrix - Secret Broadcast      SR9731       out now        CD
label: Silent / O.O.B.E.
 In '91, Andrew Johnson came across a Roland 303.  This integral piece of
equipment ultimately helped him in the creation of both his music and his
label.  Now, nearly seven years later, Astral Matrix has become one of the
most in demand producers and performers of intelligent techno on the West
Coast & North America.  Finally, Astral Matrix's acclaimed live set is now
available on a full length CD.

*Lower Haight High Hitters-House Demon      SR9716 (Silent) out now       12"
label: Silent
Ragtag, renegade house music from Ben David, Davidson, and McDavid, more
strange pseudonyms of the notorious Hardkiss boys.  Here San Francisco's
most widely known exports operate undercover to secretly deliver to Silent
a slab of dancefloor weaponry.
LIMITED EDITION TEST PRESSINGS !!!  SOLD OUT !!!

*VA-Spesh Spins Trip 'n' Spin     SR9725 (Trip 'N Spin)     out now       CD
label: Silent / Trip 'n' Spin
' Spesh Spins Trip 'n Spin ' is the culmination of five years of hard labor
from one of San Francisco's original house music labels, Trip 'N Spin
Recordings.  This live DJ mix contains both classic and current styles from
the truly underground collective that is Trip 'N Spin.  This CD is a rare
chance to hear the sound of the label from it's inception to present-day,
in one continuous live mix.  Start trippin !

*Darkhorse-Darkhorse E.P.        SR9717 (Three-Sixty)       out now        12"
label: Silent / Three-Sixty
' Three-Sixty are back with their third release !  After driving through
Death Valley and hitting Vegas, the Three-Sixty crew have split up to evade
Federal Investigators seeking them out for swindling casinos out of towels
and alcohol... '.  A quote from Three-Sixty itself, which when translated
means an more gritty funk and drum 'n bass madness from SF's newest and
most outrageous experimental dance label.

*User-Habit Form E.P.            SR9723 (Organised Noise)   out now        12"
label: Silent / Organised Noise
This is the second release from San Francisco's Organised Noise and is the
debut EP from User.  User is an alias of Jon Williams and Darin Marshall,
and this record is a slice of techno-funk guaranteed to rock floors and
minds.  From the title track to the b-sides ' Reckless Zoom ' and '
Urgionomics ', Organised Noise is attaining the level of similar quality
techno labels from Detroit to London and beyond.

*Tim 'Love' Lee-Confessions of a Selector
SR9718                                                   out now           CD
label: Silent / Three-Sixty
SF's 360 & Tim Love Lee has gotten their act together on this CD. Funky,
melodic, and sometimes just twisted, "Confessions Of A Selector" is the
90's soundtrack for life in the 70's.  As one reviewer put it, " '
Confessions ' makes me want to get naked and watch Bullitt at 6am with a
tall boy of ice cold Coors and Hunter S. Thompson at my side..."  The
effect will be different for some, but the groove is universal.

*Astral Matrix-#6                SR9718               out now          12"
label: Silent / O.O.B.E.
Straight outta San Francisco's underground, Astral Matrix's sixth 12" adds
another thumpin' chapter to the OOBE catalog.  A solid four tracker, '
Number Six ' covers a lot of territory.  From the lush technological cut '
Bass Faerie ' to the darkly percussive and minimal track ' Triangles ',
this EP is yet another achievement for this excellent local artist.

*Jondi & Spesh-We Are Connected  SR9722                out now          12"
Inspired by the Sweet! parties and ' Live at Half moon Bay ' show, this is
the second EP in the collaboration between Trip 'N Spin and Silent.  Floor
rocking trancey house with a left-coast feel.  Remixes by NovaBass.

*VA-Combine EP                 SR9714                    out now         12"
label: Silent / Organised Noise
Some of the best straight up techno west of Carl Craig, Stacey Pullen, Ian
Pooley, Derrick May, etc. All of whom are dropping it in their sets...

*VA-East Bay Conspiracy EP     SR9713                    out now          12"
label: Silent / Trip 'n Spin
Featuring the likes of ETI, Jondi & Spesh, Nick Kelly & Cave Dwellers...
A intense contribution to the San Francisco/West Coast House Movement
Deconstruction meets Hardkiss

*Various Artists-Skampler      SR9708                   out now         CD
label: Silent / Skam
ONLY PLACE TO GET AUTCHERE'S GESCOM, ET.AL. ON CD
Autechere=Warp (the label)= released by TVT= Gescom=Owners of SKAM

*Epsilon-The Black Hole SR9712                          out now          12"
label: Silent / SoundSphere Recordings
Wicked brit-style dark jungle by the artist that has surprised most
junglist with his debut appearance on several UK playlists... No U-Turn
meets Penny Black

*Mammal-The Big Ten-Four EP    SR9711                    out now         12"
label: Silent / Three-Sixty
Speaking of wicked... Thomas of Wicked Productions presents us with the
debut release as Mammal... Downtempo funk with raw/intelligent grooves

*Various Artist-Drum Kicks EP   SR9710                    out now         12"
label: Silent / XLR8R Tracks
Hot Sequel to Bad Brakes EP; more of that soothing ;) west coast sound with
a wee bit of attitude for good measure...

*Various Artists-BAD BREAKS EP  SR9709   12"              out now         12"
label: Silent / XLR8R Tracks
Mutha Beep-Beep by Professor Smith has charted in the UK; CMJ RPM and Jackpot
Reviews by Deep Dish (favorable) in MixMagUS;
1ST PRESSING SOLD OUT!!!

*Makyo-Rasa Bhava: sr9606
label: Silent
Incredibly powerful piece/includes a Bill Laswell remix... referred to this
new sound as Indihop and zen dub... Write-ups in the Wire, Fix, etc.
Reviews as shown plus...

*Various Artist-Land of Baboon (an illclectic brooklyn collection): sr9607
label: Silent
in cover stories by Option and the Wire/ranging from Dub to jungle to
trip-hop to ambient-dub/write-ups (artists and/or release) in the Wire,
Option, etc

Hi there everyone!

Just wanted to drop a quick note about an event that was intentionally
left off the calender.  From what I've seen, the only stuff that's
listed is 21+ so I figured I pass the word to the sfravers who still
check the mail... : )

So the party is in celebration of Dan, Jeff and Ashley's birthdays.  It
will be in the EastBay at a small intimate place in a nice part of
Oakland.  The capicity of this event is limited to about 180 people so
if you want to come out I'd get there early!  dj's: Jason Peacock, Sean
Murray, Jeff Taisch, John Howard, and Galen.  This event will be held at
our friends warehouse so please respect the space.  The party is only $4
but when we can't handle any more people we're going to shut the doors.  
So there it is.  If you think you'll have great time we'd love to see
you there...

	Respectfully,

        Super herbal clean tea has worked for all of my friends who have used 
it.  I beleive its one of the oldest remedies.  Friends of mine also smoked the 
night before the test and they passed.

Two easy instructions
1 start drinking lots of water now.
2 follow the instructions for the tea exactly..
Thats it.!
it can be purchased at paramount Imports off of Meridian

______________________________ Reply Separator _________________________________
Subject: Re: My friend ;) needs clean urine QUICK! please help friend
Author:  steve <sbrocksieck@compare.net> at Internet_mail
Date:    12/5/97 10:21 AM


Actually the best way is to drink a lot of water and a diuretic of some
sort (beer, coffee, cranberry juice) the night before, to flush out
your system.  Then the day of the test, drink lots again, pee a few
times before the test, and take a B-complex vitamin, so your urine 
isn't all clear.  And if you can help it, don't give them the first
or last bit out of your bladder.  My . . . uh . . . friend did this
and passed a piss test the day after smoking down.

Might check the NORML site, too, as they may have some advice.

Cheers,
Steve.

http://www.compare.net/
Information is Power

project...ATTENTION FASHION DESIGNERS.  Sorry to any that might be 
getting tired of this.  Oh yeah I DID FANTASTIC TODAY DURING MY 
PRESENTATION IN GOVERNMENT TODAY!!!

DEFINITION OF QUEST; the Irvington High Senior Graduation Project
 
WHAT IS QUEST?

A 5 component project ( QUESTION, UNDERSTAND, EXPERIENCE, SERVICE, 
TESTIMONY) Students come up with a QUESTION that leads to the exploration 
of their desired are of personal interest. UNDERSTAND is the answer to 
their QUESTION through hands-on actives, research, reading, etc.  The 
student & his/her consultant then plan out the EXPERIENCE plan related to 
the QUESTION; as in perhaps job shadowing, volunteering, training, 
designing, creating, etc.  Through SERVICE, the student designs an 
activity that allows them to share their new knowledge with the 
community.  During the TESTIMONY  the student presents their project to a 
panel of staff, peers, parents, and community members.        

The ROLE of the CONSULTANT

- Helps the student define his/her QUESTION.
- Provides the student with ideas, recommendations for research sources  
  
     that are relevant to their area of interest.
- Keeps a commitment to meet the student at agreed times (minimum of 2)
- Acts as a source of information and suggest relevant EXPERIENCE      
	 activities.
- Shares job and life experiences and provides insight.
- Helps the student to create and execute a genuine and relevant SERVICE 
       	activity.
- Gives positive feedback.
- Pushes the student to future goals and to do his/her best.            


QUEST Consultant DEADLINES

Dec. 16, 1997.....1)  Complete Consultant Agreement Form.
                        2)  Discuss Students Possible QUESTIONS.
                        3)  Provide Sources of Info to Research.
                        4)  Provide Encouragement and Feedback. 

Jan. 13,1998......1)  Complete First Interview.
                        2)  Discuss and Approve Student's Final QUESTION.
                        3)  Provide Feedback on Student's EXPERIENCE 
Plan.
                        4)  Clarify and Answer Questions About Readings; 
Verify                                 that Sources are Directly Related 
to the Student's                              QUESTION.
                        5)  Provide Encouragement and Feedback.

Feb. 24, 1998.....1)  Complete Second Interview.
                        2)  Discuss and Focus on Student's EXPERIENCE and 
                              SERVICE plan.
                        3)  Approve and Discuss SERVICE PLAN.
                        4)  Provide Encouragement and Feedback.

Additional Help That You Can Do; OPTIONAL

Attend your student's SERVICE activity, encouragement and positive-yet 
truthful feedback, help the student reflect and draw conclusions on 
his/her reflection essay, attend the TESTIMONY (Not mandatory).          
                                                                         
                   

                                                Thank You,              
                                                Teresa A. Reagor, student
                                                510-656-4832

Here we thought that Bill was the anti-christ.  I give you this postulate:



Exercise in Logic Applied
 -=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

  Given:      Barney is a cute purple dinosaur

  Prove:      Barney is Satan
  1) Start with the given:
     C U T E   P U R P L E   D I N O S A U R

  2) Change all U's to V's (which is proper Latin anyway):
     CVTE PVRPLE DINOSAVR

  3) Extract all Roman Numerals:

   C  V  V  L  D  I  V

  4) Convert into Arabic values:

  100  5  5  50  500  1  5

  5) Add all the numbers:

  666

  Coincidence?  I think NOT!

right - Terry Estioko [of Viberation fame] is having a birthday tomorrow.

that raving was for me and I thank Terry and the whole Vibe crew [esp. Li -

From sfraves-owner-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sat Dec 06 03:19:04 1997

  by taz.hyperreal.org with SMTP; 6 Dec 1997 03:18:59 -0000

          by atari.saturn5.com (8.8.6/8.8.4) with SMTP
	  id TAA13247 for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Fri, 5 Dec 1997 19:19:04 -0800 (PST)
Date: Fri, 5 Dec 1997 19:19:03 -0800 (PST)
From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
X-Sender: andy@atari
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: SFRaves (NRR-sorta...)
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.3.96.971205181451.11433F-100000@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


I don't know if any of you care, but I was really sick last weekend and
didn't feel like I had a lot to be thankful for.

I thought I was going to have to call 911, because I was so congested a
couple times I realized breathing was becoming a very difficult thing.

I thought about music a lot, and about dancing, and how beautiful it is to
feel that feeling, when you forget about whether or not your shoes are
tied, or breathing right, or who's watching, and just do a beautiful
dance.  Not because somebody else thinks it's amazing, but because you
know it's how to feel best for each part of the beat, for the track, for
the room and the people you are connecting to around you.  I never danced
as a child, my father thought it stupid, and I was raised with celebration
and frivilousness as a part of reality a good man rejected in order to
stay true to the "important" things.

I always get kinda loopy around the end of the year, because as some of
you may know, I don't live near any of my childhood (or high school or
college) friends or family. I basically have two little worlds that I live
in, the work world and the play world.  In case you're wondering, most of
you would qualify as people who I have met in my play world.

So I felt like I had no friends, and I ran into some tough moments this
week, but I wanted to thank all the really supportive words of everybody
around that kept me sane for the last year or so.

I have a few people I can really call my friends, and most of them know
who they are.  I also got a real wake up call when a couple people I had
never really spent time with just sent me these beautiful messages over
the past couple days (Leslie, Jen, Amanda, John, Alex, Herb; special
thanks to you for helping me through *one of those weeks*).

There is a lot of drama, a lot of addiction, a lot of confusion, a lot of
lies, a lot of greed and grandstanding, and a lot of stuff perhaps less
desirable than any of those going on in the scene, but at a fundamental
level the love is real. 

I started spinning out just earlier this year.  I don't know if I'm "up
there" or ever will be with a lot of the home town secrets that we have
here on the list, but I wanted to thank all the people who went out of
their way to share what music is with me (especially the long talks about
stuff from that weird perspective).

Thank you especially to the Harmony family for opening their arms and
hearts to me, and to the other families that have allowed me to grow and
learn about this magic.  The Cloud Factory, BBQ & Beats, Viberation, I do
not know how I can thank you enough for putting up with the real me... I'm
a quirky bastard, but the reward is that everything that comes back is
real.  There are other families I have been on the periphery of that have
invited me to come join with them in their celebrations of life, and to
them I owe much gratitude as well.

There are parts of the scene that are propelled by money, and there are
parts of the scene that are propelled by love and fascination.  In the
next couple months, I get the feeling it's going to be harder to tell them
apart, but I wanted to make a long clear shout out to those that still
feel the love.

I didn't sit with a family this year and count my blessings, but with this
year in particular, I wanted to come back to the people that met me with
open arms in the last year and a half or so and say thank you.

I don't think in the coming year I will be able to try quite so hard... 
and drag sound from party to party, or play out much, or stay till the
morning comes with people who deserve the world (and will get it if they
stay with an honest path and a true heart).  I am going to make sure my
play life is important, but not so important as to jeapordize what I have
spent most of my life building (which is, oddly enough, my life). 

I have learned much about forgiveness, and politics, and understanding.
I've come to have a lot of respect for people I often disagree with from
this list, and learned to give credit to people who often sell themselves
short out of confidence that they are growing in their own as I grow in
mine.

To the weirdos, the visionaries, the djs, the promoters, the happy kids
and the grumpy folk, to the people who extended amazingly with nothing but
trust in an idea, to the people I sold short, to the people who sometimes
wonder why they sweat for free, to the people who put it on the line to
show others a beautiful moment, and most of all to those who dance without
prejudice...

I love who you are collectively and in many cases individually, and I'm so
glad we live in a time when this can come into our lives in just the way
it does.  Please take care of the scene.  Stay honest, loving, open,
respectful, true, hardcore, cheap, accessible and beautiful.

I'm not leaving the list, I'm not leaving the scene, I might be mellowing
out a little and somewhere in all this I wanted to appreciate everything
we were, are and are yet to become.

Peace,
AndyW

p.s.	Todd, thanks for making me go to that second party after I swore
to never go to another after the first.










http://www.saturn5.com/andy/            http://www.saturn5.com/viberation/
         "People think love is an emotion.  Love is good sense."
                             -- Ken Kesey

whoa.  since you're like the third (fourth?) person to say something
(including a private email) i figure maybe i oughtta speak up.  i
don't know if you're referring to my post in particular, but since i
made an "age joke" i'll assume this was directed at me, among others. 
i really gotta say, the last thing i meant was to be mean - i was
trying to be funny.  i admit i'm sorta proud to be where i am today
(good job + interesting life outside of work, of which raving is a big
part) at my rather advanced age (i'm 29).  and i place a high value on
all the crazy experiences i've had over the years.  but i don't think
i'm, like, ageist or anything.

i know that some people may have problems with a younger generation
coming along and "taking" their subculture - it seems like i've heard
comments along those lines on sfraves occasionally.  but as for
myself, honestly, i have nothing against people younger than me, quite
the contrary.  i mean, what the hell would i be doing still raving if
i did?  i like raves and i like ravers, and i've never really minded
that i've grown a decade older than a lot of the people i see now at
parties. certainly i appreciate the amount of acceptance i've found in
the community despite that age difference.

i still say there are advantages to being older, but dont worry,
you'll find out for yourself.  in the meantime just enjoy the ride.

peace,
messiah

ps we've seen each other at parties, we just didn't know it.

of dumb. Just because some 16 year olds are immature, doesnt mean that
ALL 16
year olds are immature. I know people well into their 20 who act WAY
younger
than I do. So should I judge all 25 year olds by those 2 people? No. 
 
if you dont agree with what i'm saying and think its totally stupid,
thank you
for at least taking the time to read it.

MarQ   >>>

The "How Sexy Are Your Sounds" article by Sara Finlayson reads:

Music Style--HOUSE
Audience:  Platinum American Express cocaine crowd.
Attire: Sophisticated gals in tight-fitting black lycra and open-shirted
fellows sporting gold medallions. Also big among the gay community where
shirts are usually off.
Motions:  Bumping and grinding. Always sweaty.
Sex Status:  Everyone likes to "do it" here. A veritable meat market.
Get Laid?: 10 outta 10

Music Style--JUNGLE/D&B
Audience:  Fed-up ex-ravers and hyperactive Hip-Hop heads. Relatively young,
more popular with girls than most forms of electronic music.
Attire:  Hip-Hop meets rave goes for a skate and then joins the Army.
Motions:  Flipper-like motions of the hands with a few moves collected from
watching Beat Street.  Circle dancer meets MC Hammer.
Sex Status:  Jungle, like other forms of bass-heavy music, is very sexy.
Get Laid?:  6 outta 10

Music Style--TECHNO
Audience: Dudes who've been in the rave scene way too long.
Attire:  What I came in.
Motions:  Leaning against the wall discussing why Techno is superior to every
other form of music on the planet.
Sex Status:  Too busy talking about Techno to notice.
Get Laid?:  3 otta 10

Music Style--HARDCORE/GABBER
Audience:  Tweeked out teens.  Predominantly frustrated males.  Also popular
with serial killers.
Attire:  Multiple piercings, wife-beater shirts, baggy trousers, and short
hair.
Motions:  Vigorous jumping up and down, pogo'ing, and speaker fucking.
Sex Staus:  Stuck midway through adolescent masturbatory phase.  Anxious and
feverish dance style suggests an urgent need to get laid.
Get Laid?:  0 outta 10 (only a mother could love these guys)

Music Style--GOA/PSYCH TRANCE
Audience:  Crusties and anti-establishment trust fund babies
Attire:  Matted dreadlocks, tie dye, and sandals remain popular.  A faint
whiff of Nag Champa is usually evident.
Motions:  Hippie dance style reminiscent of '60s exploitation movies. Crazy
arms motions and rubbery legs usually point to excessive LSD intake.
Sex Status:  Attractive to each other. Hose down before use.
Get Laid?:  Depends on the phase of the Moon.

Music Style--PROGRESSIVE HOUSE/TRANCE
Audience:  University students and candy ravers.
Attire:  'E' friendly apparel, including fluffy backpacks, glitter,
pacifiers, and anything resembling a Dr.Suess character.
Motions:  Hands in the air.  Eyes rolling back.  Occasionally slumped against
the wall.
Sex Status:  No thanks...we're in it for the music. Hugs welcome.
Get Laid?: Males: 2 outta 10 (too busy trainspotting), Females: 6 outta 10
(they look great...to dirty old men)

Byroni's B-Day Get Togetha'

Saturday, the 6th of December 1997... Oakland, California...
Planet EARTH

** FREE for People with good vibes and love to share. **

** This party is taking place in a loft where someone lives,
but the space has been cleared for this event. 

** We can fit between 50-100 People **

If you contacted me regarding this get together please get in
gear and jet on over. If you hadn't talked to be previously
please give me a call at the number below and tell me who you're
bringing and how many.....     I'm trusting your judgement on
this one....

Lost? Need Help? 510-459-3178

DJ Times:

0800-1000 	Jake Loco
1000-1200	Andre Lucero
1200-0130	Pete and TAO
0130-0420	House Blends (4x2) Djs: Bloom,Tune,Abdul,Mes
0420-????	Johnsin (Massive Mag,Wi) Spinning Bukem-style Jungle

880/980 South
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
* Exit at 18th Street
* Take a left on 17th Street
* Go down 17th Street until you get to Madison and take a right
* Go down Madison until you get to 14th Street and take a left
* Follow 14th Street around the lake and stick to the left.
* Take a right on E18th Street
* Go down E18th street until you get to the block between 11th and
  12th street. The party is taking place in the red brick warehouse/loft
  to the left. There's a "NO PARKING" sign on the metal garage. You'll see
  us standing out there. Also there is a lit display for entering the
  access code/talking to residents.  

880 North
~~~~~~~~~

* Exit at "Oak"
* Take a right on "Jackson"
* Go down Jackson until you get to "14th street" and take a right
* Follow 14th Street around the lake and stick to the left.
* Take a right on E18th Street
* Go down 18th street until you get to the block between 11th and
  12th street. The party is taking place in the red brick warehouse/loft
  to the left. There's a "NO PARKING" sign on the metal garage. You'll see
  us standing out there. Also there is a lit display for entering the
  access code/talking to residents.  

580 West
~~~~~~~~
* Exit at "Lakeshore"
* Take a left on Lakeshore (Egghead will be on the right corner)
* Go down Lakeshore until you get to E18th Street and take a left
* Go down 18th street until you get to the block between 11th and
  12th street. The party is taking place in the red brick warehouse/loft
  to the left. There's a "NO PARKING" sign on the metal garage. You'll see
  us standing out there. Also there is a lit display for entering the
  access code/talking to residents.    


580 East
~~~~~~~~
* Exit at Grand Ave
* Take a right at the end of the exit (It's either Grand or Lakeside.. the 
name doesn't matter, just take a right at the end of the exit).
* Go down this street until you get to "El Embarcadero" (It's about a 1/2
  a block or so on the left) and take a left
* Go down "El Embarcadero" until you get to Lakeshore and take a right
* Go down Lakeshore until you get to E18th Street and take a left
* Go down 18th street until you get to the block between 11th and
  12th street. The party is taking place in the red brick warehouse/loft
  to the left. There's a "NO PARKING" sign on the metal garage. You'll see
  us standing out there. Also there is a lit display for entering the
  access code/talking to residents.    

Seeya there!

Hello All,

I have been hesitating to write this letter in order to take some time to
gather my thoughts.  After some time, and after seeing nzinga's post (hello
sistah), I wanted to briefly talk about what happened to me at my favorite
party, Stompy Stomp.

This past Sunday (December 1, 1997) I decided to take advantage of the fact
that I had some free time so my SO (Megan), Michele, and I decided to do
the Stompy Stomp.  we got there at around 4 p.m., and settlted right into
the madness.

I started drinking immediately! :)  Got to talk to a few friends (Solar,
Rawno bka Andrew Rawnsley, DJ Danni (bka 'girl' Danni), Andy, Vince,
Preston, Geoff W, and various assorted friends of friends. I sat outdie
chatting up Danni for quite a while, talked to Lon of Pure for quite a few
as well.

After all of my chattiness, and 4 beers later (for a grand total of 5...I
had done no drugs during stompy, I had taken no hallucinogens mind you) and
at about 8 p.m. I get a tap on my shoulder from this short security guard
named Ali.  At this time I had interrupted my conversation with Rawno to
talk to Mr. Security.  He asked me "Sir, can you come with me please?", I
immediately turned around and said "Sure!"  as we were walking he kept
directing me toward the front entrance (which I was not far from anyway), I
then knew something was really , really wrong.  I then asked him "Is there
a problem?", "can you please step outside sir.  You're drunk and you need
to exit the club.".  I was shocked. I had a sinking feeling that I would
not be able to get back into the club, talk to my SO, or leave in a
dignified manner.  I then asked him "Why are you asking me to leave?" (note
my tone was one of shock, not beligerance, I kept my voice low so that only
he could hear, and I was paying proper respect), "we have gotten three
complaints about you, you can't even stand up!  You bumped into three
people...", "Who were the people, I didn;t bump into anyone this evening,
I've been standing in front of the bar talking to my girl, her friend, and
my other friends...what are you talking about?  What did I do?".  "Sir,
you'll have to step outside for a while and sober up!", I said "hey man, I
didn't do anything.  As for being drunk, I am not.  I am tipsy, but I've
been standing right here having conversations with peoiple...I have done
nothing and you're throwing me out!".  At this point my voice was getting
louder and was drawing some attention.  I was going to be put out in the
cold, w/o a jacket, because, er, I was drunk?  Huh?  Well *fuck* this place
I thought.  I got some attention of my various friends, Geoof W got my
girlfriend and I told security that "Hey listen, I am not going outside.
Instead I'll leave.  You can follow me as I get my things and get my
girlfriend and her friend.  I can;t beleive this, I'm going to tell
Preston!".  At this point there are now tree security guards trying to
figure out what to do.  Ali responded "Hey Preston is just the promoter,
were security!", "Fine!", I replied "fuck this club, I'm outta here, I'm
going to stand here until my girl and jacket arrive and we're out of
security's club!".

Megan brought me my jacket (she was in worse shape than me btw), Michele
got her things (she was stumbling), and we left.  Geoff W frantically asked
me if I wanted to get Preston.  I said "Hey man, fuck this place!  Preston
is playing, don't disturb him.  These secutiy pricks are fucks, and I'm
outta here!"  By this time there is a definite commotion, Maddy tries to
talk to security but instead compliments them on the fine job they were
doing (heresey, this was tolf to me by security...I couldn't hear what
Maddy was saying. although I saw her pat security on the back).  We left
the club, and I cursed them in Arabic.  Man they were really mad.  I then
called security a bunch of pricks, to thier face, one of them threatened to
step outside the ropes, at which time I told him if he touched me it would
be battery and he would lose his balls.  By this time I am out of the club,
and losing it.  Right before I began my second series of Arab curses, I
told them all that they were a bunch of pricks, and left.  I then got in
the car, pissed, and buzzed.  I sat there for a second and stewed.  I
couldn;t beleive it, *ejected* from a stompy.  There was *nobody else*
ejected from that club, just me, for various vague reasons, by various
vague people. Hmmm...I got in my car and drove around the block.  I hadn't
had enough, so I went back around, got out of the car, got back into the
club (can you beleive this, they let me back in...), one of the security
stopped me, and I said, I just want to talk to Maddy.  I had some words ,
then left cursing again.  Got threatened again, but this time laughed and
kept walking.

Went home, and crashed.

Left messages for Preston to call me on his home and vox mail line.  We
were scheduled to have dinner on Wednesday and I informed him this would be
at the top of the agenda before anything else.

Preston and I had our meeting (as we do every month, we're very old friends
and hook up to impress each other with dinner at various great restaurants
in the city) and we laughed about what happened and talked.

At this time I told him that I thought that it was peculiar that *I* was
ejected when I was actually on top form behaviour.  I wasn't loud, I did no
controlled substances at his club, I bought drinks for friends and myself ,
tipped well, and talked with many people.  I wasn't stumbling, and I wasn't
bumping or grabbing people, I was just *talking*!  So I told him that I've
seen this kind of behaviour before in So. Cal. and in Florida (where I'm
from).  The Red Onion in So. Cal. for a long tiem had a policy of making
sure the club didn;t get, er too dark.  Or if brothers were chatty with
white women they were, er, *ejected*, for various other reasons "You're out
of dress code", or "Complaints from other patrons", or worse, not even let
in at all.  At this Stompy it felt just like that.  Vague reasons, and
vague accusers, with me merely talking to people (now at one time I was
talking to my girl, her friend, and another girl...joking around and
talking noise...basically having a good time!).  But, as in the south and
other places in this country, if they're women of another race, especially
white, this can cause some problems.  Now I have *no proof* that this was
the motive, and since there were other black males in the place who weren;t
ejected, Preston figured it was just another incident of the security at
VSF getting out of control.

I don't doubt Preston, or his expertise.  I also don't doubt people's
predjudices, and problems, nor my experiences in life.  I also cannot
discount the fact that:
-There were people who were actually stumbling and falling, even sleeping
on the dance floor. They were not ejected (I was the *only* one that
evening).
-There was someone who got some contraband confiscated.  They were not ejected.
-There were people smoking substances. They were not ejected.

The only difference between myself and the people who were not ejected was
the most obvious artifact.  I was the only person of color who was not
doing any of that stuff.  All I did was drink and chat and I was ejected.

Anyone who knows me for any period of time knows this:  I will look for
every other reason before I cry "race".  Now I do love to discuss racial
issues, and race in general, I think it is important.  But I do not live my
life thinking that there is a grand conspiracy, or that everyone has a
racial problem.  On the contrary, I think everyone has problems, race *may*
or equally *may not* be one of them.  Sometimes a cigar is a cigar and race
has little to do with someone's firing, hiring, etc.  Then  on occasion
(for some more occasion than others) there is the "race" thing that rears
it's ugly sick head.  I think my ejection was one of those times.

Preston, as wel talked, didn;t know how to approach the issue of security
with VSF.  To him, I was just another incident in a long line of incidents
with security that has happened at VSF, none of them in sequence, none of
them easily related:
-The club goes from 12-10p.m., and security decides to close the doors at
9:30 and shut down the party at roughly the same time?
-DJ's, even Preston, gettin harassed by security.  One of them even
threatened Preston while playing.
-Not allowing people in's & out's when it's raining and cold outside
(basically allowing people to leave w/o telling them they can't get back
in).

And the list goes on.

During the dinner Preston said he would talk with security, but didn't know
how he would apprach this problem or the littany of others, since they are
not related.  I insisted that something was particualrly weird about my
ejection versus people who were really off their rocker.  In the end, he
was puzzled to.

I am no longer puzzled.  VSF has a very serious problem with their
security, and their security has problems with people of color at raves.

I did happen to talk to Ali, and when I mentioned to him that it might be a
racial thing he said "Hey man, we have many African-American's at our club.
We host a party on Wednesday that is primarily African-American.  We have
no problem with African-Americans", I replied "Yes, but you do have a
problem when there is a minority of Af-Am's & majority of whites mixing!".
Silence, then a restatement of his facts and views.

Now the data can be intepreted many ways:
-I was drunk and had to go. (Ok for arguments sake given, then why was this
not applied to all the patrons equally?).
-VSF Security doesn't have a problem with Af. Am's because they do host a
Wednesday Hip-Hop thang.  (Ok for arguments sake given,  but that does not
answer the question of do they have a problem when Af ams are in the
minority?  *OR* do they have a problem with af-am's being ravers instead of
hip-hopper's?  Hmmm....).
-I just got caught in the trap. (Ok given, why was I the only one?).


I have no beef with Stompy.  I love Stompy and the crew of Stompy.  I love
Preston, he's my man.  However, I have serious reservations about VSF and
it's prejudiced security.  I know of one other brother who got shit that
night, and I'll leave it to him to discuss his problems if he wishes.  But
the fact that I was singled out, in the midst of everything else, and
wasn't doing anything leaves me suspect.  All things given, and everything
equal, I was singled out.  From my view, because I am black and was
chatting up with too may ladies of the opposite race.  That is the only
disinction between me and others in the club who were not ejected.

Yes, times have changed.  But there are vortices of the past everywhere.
there is obviously one at VSF.

I called VSF twice, talked to todd and he hasn;t called me back.  Tristan
is the  manager and I've not heard from him.  So their silence is
acceptance.

Brothers and sisters be warned.  If you are a person of color at that club,
be very careful of what you do and who you do it with.  Security is
watching, and they've got a job to do! ;(

(NOTE:  VSF security is *looking* for you to be doing something wrong.  You
probalby won't be ejected, but they will use thier brute force to take what
you have, pocket it, use it, and let you alone.  You have been warned.  Be
careful).

I won't be going to any more events @ VSF until I get some satisfaction
that this problem has been solved.

I'm done with VSF,
John

P.S.  I wonder does VSF know that if I got into a car accident because I
was to drunk to drive that *they* are held *totally* responsible
(precedence for this is california law!).  Hmmm...maybe it's time for me to
join the litiginous frey.  I'm consdering my options.

P.S.S.  Also note, I took this to all parties concerned before talking
about it publicly.  I gave this issue alot of thought.  I would be saddened
if this hurt my friends party, but *I* was hurt, and this could have caused
irreperable harm to me my family, and of course the club (i.e. if they come
to the conclusion someones drunk, cut them off, don't send them out into
the streets).  Draw your own conclusions and act in accordance with your
concience.

Peace! And I'm sorry this post was so long, but reality happens! :)

"The first casualty of war is truth." - Rudyard Kipling

I myself had some "strange" interactions at the last Stompy with the
security force at the club. I'm not sure about these guys, I personally
have worked with, a lease 70% of the guys who do club security in San
Francisco. I myself have done (and will do) security at underground parties
and other events, most of these guys know me, they know where I'm coming
from, and that I treat them with the utmost respect.  This bunch at VSF
seems to be "green" at least. They have been accused of doing the standard
immature thing of watching people, cornering them, confiscating their
stashes AND DISTRIBUTING THE WARES AMONGST THMESELVES. I had an incident
with one where I was following a promoter out to her car to get more flyers
for an upcoming party to be held AT THAT VENUE!! I asked the security guard
(sensing the foolishness that had been going on all night) whether I could
go out with the person, escort her to her car and get the flyers, he said
no If I go out I gotta pay again, I said I didn't pay in the first place :)
and I'm just going to flyers to promote an upcoming party AT THIS VENUE,
the guy then gets a little belligerent (which to me was kinda funny cuz I
have a good 1 foot of height on him :) pushes his chest into me like saying
hey don't give me any shit, the promoter I was with sensed an altercation
brewing and diffused it by quickly going into her backpack and giving me
what flyers she had left :) I didn't think much of this incident, (except
that the security seemed on roids or crank, a condition that I have come in
contact with before) but then John was ejected for doing absolutely 
NOTHING! ( I was with him off and on for most of the night and he seemed
very well behaved, in a party where the bottom line is to get a good crack on.
I saw many people in a more extreme state of inebriation then John was in
yet they were not ejected. I myself had one glass of cider the entire
night, and got weird shit from the security, could it be the fact that I
was holding hands with a beautiful Caucasian woman and these guys got
pissed off? I don't know, my mind generally doesn't go there, the promoter
and I are friends, as with most of my friends we hug sometimes kiss and
hold hands as many raver's do.  I myself came with 4 women one arabic, one
African and two europeans. I flirted with many more :) There were not a lot
of African American males in the club so I don't know what this means, I'd
like to think that it just is security on 'roids and not racially motivated
because if it is it will put a very bad damper on one of the most diverse
and interesting parties that San Francisco has to offer, I hope Preston get
his house in order cuz "we don't need this Fascist groove thang!"


								G

does not mean that John had.  I was there and John was not as messed up as
MANY others in attendance.  Ever been to a Stompy?  The attendees generally
tend to take things to record levels of intoxication.  John, unlike many
others, was in control of himself.

>

In the 3+ years I have know John, I have heard and participated in many
discussions with him regarding race.  (It is an important topic which
people shy away from for any number of reasons.)  But regardless of how
much John *talks about* race, this is the one and only time I have ever
known him to accuse anyone of having racially charged motives.  It is not
something he takes lightly and would not falsely accuse it if he did not
have VERY good reason.  Having been present at the time, I must agree that
there *was* VERY good reason.  And don't try to say that I was drunk and my
opinion should be dismissed.  Just casue I was swaying doesn't mean I was
blind.

who were there (one of which, you are not) and saw him NOT being ripped or
doing any of the things he was accussed of.  Thanks anyway for the opinion,
Andy.  Next time keep it to yourself unless you know what you're talking
about.

By the way, sometimes proof is not necessary to feel that something is
true.  People can say all kinds of things to deflect from their true
motives, especially when that motive is not socially acceptable.  And even
if their motive was not racial, it does not change the fact that John was
ejected from the club for things he DID NOT DO.

OKEE...time to add a few more pennies to the pot...

Age is really just a nember...how many people do you know that ACT
their age?  Is the number of years you've been on this planet a true
measure of maturity, ability, intelligence, and matters of legal
convenience?  For some, their time to enjoy life could very well be
limited...and who is to say they cannot be as mature as one who is 20
or 30 at the age of 16?  I agree that in MOST cases, age does play an
important role in determining how OLD someone is, but one that I have
learned from the scene is the elimination of our stereotypes and
preconcieved notions.  For every rule there is always an exception. 
Just LuV each other...even if it is against the law!  ;^)
Take care...sNIKers ;^)

Hello everyone,

My vinyl archiving on to CD days are still in continuation. 
I'm unshaven, tired, gnarly, but dedicated to finishing. It's funny how much
longer songs seem to be when I have to let them play all the way through. I've
had some of these songs for almost 8 years and never heard the whole song!
(I'm like, "wow, that was pretty cool, shoulda let that one play through,
man..." :)   

Anyway, does anyone know what type of music "Handbag House" is?
What typifies this genre? Been reading about it in some of these U.K. mags,
but I don't have a frame reference. Is it an attitude or a style of music like
Speed Garage?

Thanks,

rob.
http://www.citizenmag.com

> just doing too many 'roids or the substances that they are confiscating is
> unclear but other people sense that something is wrong as well.

Yeah, I was talking about the problem VSF sec allegedly has w/ people of
color.

> Maybe you should do a little investigation before you speak about things
> that you do not know.

If you post here, expect a response. Don't expect to agree with it.

As we were driving to Oakland last night to Byroni's
b-day (which I hope he enjoyed thoroughly)  my friend
was relaying a story about a party that she was at
where this guy kept starring at her.  Finally, she
went over to him and said "look, do I know you?"
his response was "no, but I wish I did."

The point of the story was that this was the worst
pickup line that she had ever heard.  Of course I'm
thinking- god I could seem myself saying something
like that.

So I was wondering br you boy or girl straight or gay.

A. have you ever been hit on at a party(rave).
B. What was your favorite pickup line, the best or
worst one that you ever heard.

indulge my craving for gossip.

pj fuzzy







From sfraves-owner-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sun Dec 07 16:31:27 1997
Return-Path: <sfraves-owner-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 14956 invoked by uid 6000); 7 Dec 1997 16:31:26 -0000
Received: (qmail 14948 invoked from network); 7 Dec 1997 16:31:25 -0000
Received: from web4.rocketmail.com (205.180.57.78)
  by taz.hyperreal.org with SMTP; 7 Dec 1997 16:31:25 -0000
Message-ID: <19971207162908.28553.rocketmail@web4.rocketmail.com>
Received: from [152.163.204.135] by web4; Sun, 07 Dec 1997 08:29:08 PST
Date: Sun, 7 Dec 1997 08:29:08 -0800 (PST)
From: sNIKers <xtcin69@rocketmail.com>
Reply-To: XTCin69@aol.com
Subject: MY First Sacramento part*E* (Fun For Kids review)
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

My my my...where do I start?  Well, as I said, this was my first
Sacramento part*E*, and I was pleased with the scene they have uo
there.  We got to the part*E* relatively late, (around 2), but it
didn't matter because the part*E* went till 8 in da morn!  Plus, it
was free with a Toy Donation, (I personally gave one of those cute
lil' doggies from teh 101 Damations..heheh...his name was Dipstick!),
and all of the toys went to Charity, so kidZ could have a good
Christmas.  I don't think I have ever felt more satisfied going to a
part*E*, because we KNEW that a child would get what we gave
them...kind of a nice, happy feeling, actually benifitting a good
cause directly.
  ON to the part*E*.  THe music was progressive house, and of decent
quality, although a bit slow for my taste.  There were a good amount
in that one roomed warehouse, and not many were dancing, and there
were circles...to my slight dipleasure.  As the night progressed, many
flocked out while the hardKore kidZ stayed and danced the night
away...the music seemed to intensify as the night went on, by the 2nd
to the last DJ, they actually spun a trance record! (YAY!)  We danced
and danced and danced...met quite a few of those "valley" kidZ, (they
are pretty darn kewl, if ya just talk to them!), and danced somemore. 
Leaving the part*E* well spent, and with visions of a kidZ Christmas
being jsut a little bit brighter because of us left us with warm
fuzzies.
  Overall, the scene, (for those of you that haven't experienced it),
is sort of a cross between a SF Underground and an Oakland   One Room
wonder.  Maybe because we arrived late, but I didn't get any of those
pushy people tryiing to sell me Vitamins and materials for a chemistry
lab.  The *few* kand*E* kidZ i met were ULTRA kewl, and jsut about
everyone had a decent vibe emitting from them.  I can't say that I am
going to flock to Sacramento for every part*E* they throw in the
future, but I sure wouldn't mind going to a part*E* or two every once
in a whiel!

For all you SACRAMENTO KIDZ....THANX for making me feel welcome!

PLUR, HugZ, and LuV,
sNIKers ;^*

At 7:59 AM -0800 12/7/97, pj fuzzy wrote:
(snip)
>A. have you ever been hit on at a party(rave).
>B. What was your favorite pickup line, the best or
>worst one that you ever heard.
>
>indulge my craving for gossip.
>
>pj fuzzy

Well, I was hit on at a party one time by someone who I will not mention by
name since some of you probably know him.  It was really weird.  While I
was dancing (had been for hours, in the same spot) I noticed that someone
was sitting up on a speaker above me.  It didn't occur to me that he was
watching me or anything but I guess he had been because right when the
music stopped he jumped down and made a bee line towards me.  He proceeded
to get down on his knees and then  asked me to send him my prayers and all
this stuff.  He, at the time, didn't want to tell me his name and said I
could make up a name for him cause he had made up a anme for me: Bubble
Girl.  Okaaaaay...  I thought the guy was just on some good shit that
night, so I humored him, ended the conversation and went home.  Didn't
think too much about it again.

That is until I saw him at again @ Home Base a couple of weeks later.  He
was lurking around me and staring at me where ever I was.  I mean, how esay
is it to keep track of someone @ Home Base?  He had to have been following
me around the entire time.  Dude was persistant and it was starting to
freak me out.  He finally cought me off gaurd and said some weird shit to
me and I just told him that he was making me feel uncomfortable and I
wanted him to leave me alone.  I was still a bit shaken when I left the
party but kind of thought this was the end of it.

That is until I got a call from my friend Tim who told me that this guy had
come to his house.  (Tim doesn't even know the guy but he had obviously
been doing his homework and knew that Tim was close to me.  Getting
weirder, huh?)  He gave Tim a letter to give to me.  Tim gets the letter
over to me and I read it.  Okay - this is going too far.  He felt the need
to go into all this personal shit, telling me about his social and personal
problems and inability to express himself to girls who he has crushes on.
As much as the letter made me uncomfortable, I felt bad for the guy.  I
didn't know what to do so I did nothing.  Hoped he would leave me alone and
this would be over.

It pretty much ended there until I, shortly there after, I hooked up with
my beloved John S. Lee.  John thought I was being too soft on the guy by
not taking any action.  The more I talked to John about it, I had to admit
that he was right.  I didn't want to admit that the situation was really
sketchy.  I was naieve in beliving that this guy's affections were
innocent.  I should have gone with my instincs and been more aggressive in
my effort to get this monkey off my back.

My point?  Don't underestimate people who make you feel uncomfortable.
Follow your instincts and make yourslef clear if you don't wish to be
cantacted further.  Just because someone is a raver, does not mean that
they are incapable of doing something that could really hurt another
person.

Secondly, I DO NOT advise use of these tactics if you want to meet someone
at a party.  Just go up and say hello.  Or better yet, just dance by them
and see if there is any connection.  the worst that can happen is you make
a new dance floor friend!  It you can't get it together enough to do that
in a saine manner, you're better off leaving the person alone.

Sorry for the rambling story, but hey... you asked. ;)
Megan

>>>faint whiff of Nag Champa is usually evident.
>>>Motions:  Hippie dance style reminiscent of '60s exploitation movies.
>>>Crazy arms motions and rubbery legs usually point to excessive LSD
>>>intake.
>>>Sex Status:  Attractive to each other. Hose down before use.
>>>Get Laid?:  Depends on the phase of the Moon.

Cindy Kawakami wrote:
> 
> > Anyway, does anyone know what type of music "Handbag House" is?
> > What typifies this genre? Been reading about it in some of these U.K. mags,
> > but I don't have a frame reference. Is it an attitude or a style of music like
> > Speed Garage?
> 
> Handbag house refers to people (or women) who usually stand around and
> drop their handbags to dance. Or you can say it gets the general audience
> who isn't into techno music to dance. Some of the usual handbag music
> that's out there is the things that you hear on the radio like Close to My
> Lips by Tori Amos, What is Love? by Haddaway, etc.
> 
> Hope this helps.
