Hello EVRY-1 out in cyber-ville.  Hope that everyone is doing dandy, dry
and -- 'hi' to you newbes out there too.
=)

     Heres a bit'o'history; In MArch, Rebel Alliance Sound (aka RAS) hosted
a sucessful, free, outdoor event called _A New Hope_.  Dispite the cold,
cops, and a pesky crab we -the crew, DJ's, and partygoers- created a great
vibe and I hope that some of you out there that attended have fond memories
of that night.  In the consecutive months RAS organized, co-ordinated, and
assisted with various other sound crews to churn out decent underground
parties, all with very positive responses from you, dear raver.

     So to close out the year, and in the spirit of giving, RAS will be
having our finial party of 1997.  The event will be indoors, Free (although
donations will be extremely appreciated), and TOTALLY renegade.  Please
note that ALL RAS parties are done for the love and celebration of music
and dance as well as the scene it represents.  It's about a good time,
plain and simple.  All that we here ask is that you come with a positive
attitude, good vibes, WARM clothes and early, since the capacity of this
central SF location is Very limited.  Alcohol and smoking is to your own
discretion, so please be wise & discreet.

     So if you're bored off your bum and wanna have some fun, drop by and
dance to the cool sounds of: Joesph, Trace, Mary,  Anakin and Alex. Give a
call on the info line Saturday, the 13th. (510.218.7494) 'round 10PM for
directions.

     __PLEASE DO NOT POST TO THE CALENDAR AS THE LOCATION CANNOT POSSIBLY
HOLD THE AMOUNT OF PEOPLE THE CALENDAR USUALLY GENERATES__



     And to start off 98' proper, look out for RAS next event _POLARIS_
coming ta ya indoors, and in the East Bay, in January.



**Final Note:  (Anakin Here:) Thank you SFRavers for your patience.  My
first Mixtape _UNE_ is finally out and available.  A considerable amount of
gradidtude is due to the SFR family.  Many of you have influenced me
greatly in the production of this tape.  Thanks again.  although I cannot
control the pricing @ the various shops. If you run into me @ a party and I
have some tapes, I'll give ya the SFR discount =)...



                                                           And Merry X-mas.

(since we're not on the list yet, it'd be appreciated if someone could dial
the aforementioned number listed with code 303 to make sure that this post
                         went through... thanks.)



And wherever ya go ----  Play Hard.

From: jasonelee@juno.com

Precedence: bulk

After reading all this email that pours into my box, I can't helpmyself
to think about learning more about  you and what your interests are....
so if you have the time fill this out... and post on the list, Im sure
others are just as interested in you as I am.

Example:

Name (or Nickname) Jaylee

What is your Age= 24
Birthday (2-27-73)
What is your Sign= Pices
Are you Married= No
Have Kids= No
Are you Single= No
Do you Dj = Yes
What is your most listened to Style of Music? = Progressive / Breaks
Musician / Artist= No
Hobbies= Dj'ing
Favorite Sexual Position= All
Ideal Party Linup= Sasha, RITM, Jim Hopkins, Fluke, Uberzone, Bass Bin
Twins
Favorite Food= Mexican / Chinese
Mission In Life= Learn to Love more, be more openminded and Help others
more.
Favorite DJ= Undetermined
Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? = Positively
How? = Sharing and Caring
Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex? =
Music

You can add to it if you want ... spice it up... but I think it wil add
to everyones connection with each other and help to create a stronger
bond and relationship with one another.....

Give it a Try!!!

Love Jason
Promo Magazine
http://www.djmike.com/promomag
December 19th in Los Angeles - Winterfresh
(818)948-4363

Hello Sfraves!

I just wanted to tell everyone that tickets for this upcoming Harmony Party
(Beautiful People) are going to be on sale as of this Saturday night,
December 13th. They will be on sale at the following locations for $20.
(note there might be a $1 surcharge depending on where you go)

In the South Bay, go to "Solid Grooves" @ 368 South Bascom Ave, San Jose

In the East Bay, go to "The Trance And Jungle Factory" @ 2575 Telegraph
Ave, Berkeley

In the SF Area, go to "F-8" @ 1816 Haight St, San Francisco

In the North Bay, go to "Harmonics" @ 1067 Fourth Street, Santa Rosa

There are a limited number of tickets available, so we encourage you to not
procrastinate!
 We can't wait for this party! It is going to be so beautiful! Remember to
try to come in costume ; ) See ya there!!! 

Peace and loooooove!!!,

Greg = )

I have attached the most recent Harmony Mailer... If you aren't on the
"snail mail" list you shoud read it. If you want to be put on it, then send
me your name and full address and you will be added to our mailing list.
It's really cool trust me ; ) We are still using crayons and markers...
(long story, and I don't want to go into it)
--=====================_881921334==_

>felt someone tap her on the shoulder. She turned around to find some
>gurning fuck jacking it right there. Needless to say he was forcibly
>ejected quickly.

This happened to my friend at the FTT Halloween Tribal Massive.  We were in
the main room where Josh Wink was going off and she turned around and 2
guys were jerking off right behind her.  This was her 1st party, so now she
won't go to another one because of this incident.  She thinks this kind of
thing always happens.I tried to convince her that this was a complete freak
incident but her opinion has already been formed.

jason

The holidays are bringing tons of parties almost every night of the
week.  There's another good selection this weekend, starting with
Pure Space tonight, and continuing with more and more on Friday
and Saturday.  Sunday features the Bulletproof boat party and BT and
a benefit; and the groove continues into next week.  Didn't find
anything for Monday though, maybe try Sister or Density or No TV
from the weeklies...


                              The SFR Calendar
                                      
           http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi

                             Radio/TV/Net Shows
                                      
     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)
     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night midnight-1am - "Shortwave" - Electronic music in all
       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Tuesday night 11:30pm-2:30am - "Conscious Groove" - a show all
       about ambientdowntempojungletechnotrancedrumnbasstriphoplove and
       more with weekly guest DJs. Free Radio Berkeley 104.1.
     * Wednesday night 9pm-11pm - free form music mix. KPFA 94.1
       (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning - "the tube" hosted by miss laura
       aka lola. an electronic excursion into ambient soundscapes,
       ethereal trance, and washes of other whimsical muzik. KAZU 90.3
       (Monterey Bay Community Radio)
     * Thursday morning 10am-2pm - "The Further Adventures of Aardvark" -
       trip-hop to experimental to ambient to gabba etc, etc. KSJS 90.5
       (San Jose).
     * Thursday 5pm-9pm - The Beta Lounge - Live netcast of jungle, dub,
       breakbeat, hiphop, ambient, experimental.
       http://www.betalounge.com/
     * Thursday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. The
       best in beats to satiate your inner child. Electronic dance,
       noise, spoken word, world music and more. Also available in
       RealAudio. KZSU 90.1 (Stanford)
     * Friday 10am-3pm - weekly DJ netcasts. x-radio.
     * Friday 3pm-6pm - free form music mix. KUSF 90.3 (SF) (also
       available on Realaudio
     * Friday 9:30am-noon - Snappy the Aligator plays deep groove music
       that dips into cool electronic sounds, classic soul, reggae &
       more. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on KUSF
       90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Jungle, Detroit, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, and
       noise KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - "Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs from
       SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night 9pm-mid - "Underbrush" w/DJ Radon and guests -
       Beats, Breakz and Buzz KZSU 90.1 (Stanford). Also broadcast via
       RealAudio.
     * Saturday night 11pm - Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. flux@flux.net
     * (every other) Saturday night 10p-12:30a - "1984" w/DJ Richtoffen.
       House, Trance and German rave. 90.1 (Chico)
     * Saturday night - "amp" 1am. MTV.
     * Saturday night - "Subsonic". 1am-6am, KITS 105.3 SF.
     * Saturday night - "House Nation" w/"Anthems Mix", Top 10s from
       guest DJs and "London Connection w/DJ Doubt". 2am-4am, WILD 94.9
       SF.
     * Ambiance Magazine - 9:30p weds-sun PNC Cable 2 (Modesto &
       Oakdale), 9p fri & sat, marcus cable ch 9 (ceres & turlock).

                            Administrative Notes
                                      
   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
    Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.org

From: Messiah Wannabe <messiahw@rocketmail.com>
Subject: Interracial > crossing
To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Cc: "Minh Q. Le" <mlowdrma@OCF.Berkeley.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk




> 	Oh, and I also wanted to add to Mr N'Stuff's thread: Interracial
> crossing is very good in the biological and cultural exchange sense; 
> too bad social mores are still so primitive.



i was thinking about genetics and darwinism and "interracial crossing"
- first, i was thinking that, while evolution via the survival of the
fittest is a good theory, i've always suspected there was more to the
diversity of species than just that.  that perhaps there was some sort
of intelligence involved in the way that dna instructions were changed
or mutated or combined.

for instance:  a person born of asian parents will have natural
resistance to the diseases of that part of the world, whereas someone
born of european parents will have resistance to diseases that are
common to europe.  so will a eurasian child be more likely to be
resistant to the diseases of both, without first undergoing a natural
selection process?

i also understand that your average mutt canine will outlive most
thoroughbreds, as well as outdo them in intellegence tests.  of course
there was some serious inbreeding involved in producing most
thoroughbreds.

the thing is i can't back up any of this with hard facts (not that
there really are such things as hard facts...)  minh, you're some sort
of biologist aren't you?  i'd be interested in hearing some scientific
theory in this area, on or off the list.

as far as the cultural sense, i feel that different cultures
(obviously) have different ways of viewing the world in countless
ways.  ways which can't often be transmitted exept through long term
contact with, or immersion in, that culture.  and "learning" more than
one culture gives you several ways of seeing/interacting with the
world, which can perhaps be used selectively (ie you take the best
parts of each culture and incorporate them into your own world view. 
or use them selectively, depending on circumstance). 

-messiah

Do you Dj = I try...

What is your most listened to Style of Music? = Minimal Ambient Detroit
style Goa Breaks... and that techno stuff, and ambient, and trance, and
house, and progressive house, and whatever else is on & honest...
listening to good music is what it's about, every style has a couple
shitty records in it, and most music does it for me at one time or
anothEr.

Musician / Artist= Trying... still can't draw circles, but I can do gears
like a master now.

Hobbies= Unkinking speaker cables, alphabetizing my vinyl collection,
bpm'ing everything I own (my alarm clock beeps at 140 bpm, perfect for
techno btw), writing long winded email, flaming people I haven't met yet,
discussing PLUR with people who steal money from their parents so they can
buy crank, snowboarding (cu@*geyz2!), geek stuff, trying to get a
non-cheesy sound out of my Korg X5, watching good movies, eating.

wrists

Ideal Party Linup= Cari Lekebush, Juan Atkins, Derrick May, John Williams,
James aka Slayer, Fat Tony playin phat ass disco in the morning... while
Joe serves em up shaken, not stirred.

Favorite Food= DJ Food, off Ninja Tunes (psychotically spicy Thai
actually...)

Mission In Life= To get people to stop crossposting to multiple regional
rave lists. 

Favorite DJ= Whoever plays the best tracks for that moment in time... it's
not about superstars, it's about moments in time.

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? = Negatively.  I have
been getting in touch with my inner jerk for several years now. 

How? = Being sarcastic on SFRaves. 

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex? =
This is a bit "breeder-centric" don't you think?  I go to sell bunk E.

Peace...
Andy

and have worded it carefully so i do not incriminate myself :-}

> What is your Age= 20  
>sign= i'm a scorpio, with a lot of libra influence (cusp).  
> Do you Dj = no
> What is your most listened to Style of Music? = jungle, hardcore, classic rock (avid zeppelin fan, classical (the 1812 Overature moves me...) and i keep an open mind, EXCEPT country music for reasons i will not discuss.
> Musician / Artist= took piano lessons as a kid, only play by ear now
> Hobbies/Interests= music, irc, sorta interested in astrology lately (also, energy. like tao and tai chi n stuff) meeting new cool people, dancing, but most of all, i cherish my sleep.
> Favorite Food= too many to name, but i have a sweet tooth.
> Mission In Life= to go somewhere in life, travel, do fun stuff (still have never skiied) and basically be able to be financially stable unlike my upbringing. also, to achieve and maintain peace of mind.
> Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? = i try more on the positive
> How? = i respect the scene, i try to give out good vibe.  i believe in karma.  and i do NOT beleive in coincidence.
> Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex? =
> i've done it for both reasons.  i basically go to parties now to go OUT, feel like i have a life, enjoy the fat music, and have as good as time as possible amongst friends, then go home and get sleep (see hobbies/interests)

At 12:54 PM 12/11/97, Christopher Porter wrote:
>What I always find interesting about this recurring thread, is that
>chivalry is only remembered as it was/is applied to women.  Chivalry was a
>code of conduct that governed ones behavior towards both sexes, in all
>aspects of life.  Example, during a fight, if you disarmed your opponent,
>you would discard your weapon before continuing the fight...


__t h a n k  y o u__.

>
>I've always wondered why men no longer think to treat each other like
>this, but we feel guilty if we don't act chivalrous towards women.

really?
>
>And yes, I do know that the code of chivalry served to enforce the idea
>that some men were intrinsically better than others... The commoners
>weren't expected to act nobly, blah blah blah.   I didn't say chivalry was
>all good, blah blah...

what, weren't expected to act polite? i'd think that at least _some_ of
them did? it's the ideal, of being polite, i think that has been lost. god,
it almost sounds conservative, which is another misconception. maybe i'm
too idealistic, but shouldn't it be a goal to be polite and to respect
*all* people? it really has nothing to *do* with equal rights - as i stated
earlier, strides made in equality would seem to make people _more_
respectful and polite rather than less so. but then again, life just
doesn't make sense sometimes, does it. oh well - you do what you can,
right?

cheers - e. :)

At 1:04 PM 12/11/97, SolR wrote:
>whoa. being kind and courteous, having a bit of manners... noticing that
>the end of someone's cigarette is cold, while you're holding a lighter...
>ok, granted... i don't open doors for men, but i hold it open until they
>put a hand on it if they are right behind me..
>I open doors for little kids, and will stand with a door open for 3 or 4
>women to go through if they are in an obvious group.  NEVER, never did it
>cross my mind that they were incapable of opening the door for themselves


so now wait! how come i'm not meeting any of these men??? :o

(and hey - holding 5 bags of groceries might incapacitate you, male or female.)

i have held doors for men (being female), but i have also seen my father do
it countless times. common courtesy. or at least it used to be.


>>but i don't want to be treated like a princess, i don't need simple things
>****
>why not?  everyone enjoys a little pampering.

no shit! men especially!

i suppose this is merely a case of understanding a word to mean different
things. i kid you not, i always thought the word "gentile" to mean kind.
never bothered to look it up. until i got into this debate over it. here
again, there are dual meanings. i've been thinking of chivalry as the act
of being chivalrous, which is defined as: characteristic of or relating to
the ideal of a knight...marked by fairness, generosity and kindliness, (and
here the questioned inequality) esp. to foes, the weak, the weak and lowly,
and the vanquished.... so what then philanthropy? is this discriminating in
a sense? nowhere does it say you have to owe any body anything if they
treat you with respect... this is something that has developed along the
way somewhere. and isn't that what inequality is? we owe you 'coz we're not
as *whatever* as you?

snip

>>but that isn't about gender.   just like giving your seat to a pregnant
>>woman on the bus isn't because she's a woman, it's because she's
>****
>it's not likely i would give up my seat to a woman on a bus.  who would?
>she can find  her own damn seat. [there, happy?] when she gives up her seat
>to me.. then we'll see.

but i have offered my seat in a club.... okay, but then i don't take
busses. they *do* look awfully crowded tho! i'd probably only give my seat
up for an elder. or if they look really ill or somehting (okay, i'm
babbling, but it's like when you're waiting and waiting to pee and some
girl comes in looking like she's about to loose her shit all over the place
- of course you give up your place in line!) so many of these things are
situational. ya know?

>>my dream is to live in a world where we treat everyone respectfully and
>>with consideration of the individual person they are, regardless of their
>>gender, race, age, etc,  because that's the way it should be.  no princes,
>>no princesses.
>****
>I do what I do, may it be chivalric in anyway, because it makes me feel
>good to do it.  Opening a door and getting a smile out of someone is more
>than enough thanks for me... I may live in a mostly thankless world, but it
>doesn't mean I'm going to be any less courteous.

i think we're going for the same point here, just using different terminology.

enough for tonight already!

cheers - e. :)

      Why do you need a drivers license to buy liquor when you cant
drink and drive?

      Why isnt phonetic spelled the way it sounds?

      Why are there interstate highways in Hawaii?

      Why are there flotation devices under plane seats instead of
parachutes?

      Why are cigarettes sold in gas stations when smoking is prohibited
there?

      Do you need a silencer if you are going to shoot a mime?

      Have you ever imagined a world with no hypothetical situations?

      How does the guy who drives the snowplow get to work in the
mornings?

      If 7-11 is open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, why are there
locks on the doors?

      If a cow laughed, would milk come out her nose?

      If nothing ever sticks to Teflon, how do they Teflon stick to the
pan?

      If you tied buttered toast to the back of a cat and dropped it from
a height, what
      would happen?

      If youre in a vehicle going the speed of light, what happens when
you turn on the
      headlights?

      You know how most packages say "Open here"? What is the protocol if
the       package
      says, "Open somewhere else?"

      Why do they put Braille dots on the keypad of the drive-up ATM?

      Why do we drive on parkways and park on driveways?

      Why is it that when you transport something by car, its called a
shipment, but      when
      you transport something by ship, its called cargo?

      You know that little indestructible black box that is used on
planes? Why cant they
      make the whole plane out of the same substance?

      Why is it that when youre driving and looking for an address, you
turn down the
      volume on the radio?

      Do vegetarians eat animal crackers?

      Why are they called apartments when they are all stuck together?

      If fire fighters fight fires, and crime fighters fight crime, what
do freedom fighters       fight?

      If con is the opposite of pro, is Congress the opposite of
progress?

      If olive oil comes from olives, where does baby oil come from?

      Did you know who in 1923 was:

      1. President of the largest steel company?
      2. President of the largest gas company?
      3. President of the New York Stock Exchange?
      4. Greatest wheat speculator?
      5. President of the Bank of International Settlement?
      6. Great Bear of Wall Street?

      These men should have been considered some of the worlds most
successful       men. At
      least they found the secret of making money.

      Now more than 55 years later, do you know what has become of these
men?

      1. The President of the largest steel company, Charles Schwab, died
a pauper.

      2. The President of the largest gas company, Edward Hopson, is
insane.

      3. The President of the N.Y.S.E., Richard Whitney, was released
from prison to die       at
      home.

      4. The greatest wheat speculator, Arthur Cooger, died abroad,
penniless.

      5. The President of the Bank of International Settlement shot
himself.

      6. The Great Bear of Wall Street, Cosabee Rivermore, committed
suicide.

      The same year, 1923, the winner of the most important Dance
championship,       Johny Suthers, won the International groove
Tournaments. Today he is still       phreaking the floor.

      Conclusion: Stop worrying about stoopid shit and start shaking that
ASS!

Date: Thu, 11 Dec 1997 23:24:20 -0800

Message-ID: <19971211.233742.6223.1.jasonelee@juno.com>
X-Mailer: Juno 1.38
X-Juno-Line-Breaks: 1,4-5,7,9,11,14-15,29-30,35-36,46-47,58-59,61-63
From: jasonelee@juno.com

Precedence: bulk

1) No known species of reindeer can fly. BUT there are 300,000 species of
living
      organisms yet to be classified, and while most of these are insects
and germs,       this does not COMPLETELY rule out flying reindeer, which
only Santa has ever       seen.

      2) There are 2 billion children (persons under 18) in the world.
But since Santa
      doesnt appear to handle the Muslim, Hindu, Jewish and Buddhist
children, that
      reduces the workload to 15% of the total - 378 million according to
Population
      Reference Bureau. At an average (census) rate of 3.5 children per
household,       thats 91.8 million homes. One presumes theres at least
one good child in each.

      3) Santa has 31 hours of Christmas to work with, thanks to the
difference time       zonesand the rotation of the earth, assuming he
travels east to west (which             seems logical).  This works out
to 822.6 visits per second. This is to say that for each
Christianhousehold with good children, Santa has 1/1000th of a second to
park, hop out of the sleigh, jump down the chimney, fill the stockings,
distribute the remaining presents under the tree, eat whatever snacks
have been left, get back up the chimney, get back into the sleigh and
move on to the next house. Assuming that each of these 91.8 million stops
are evenly distributed around the earth (which, of course, we know to be
false but for the purposes of our calculations we will accept), we are
now talking about .78 miles per household, a total trip of 75-1/2 million
miles, not counting stops to do what most of us must do at least once
every 31 hours, plus feeding and etc.

      This means that Santas sleigh is moving at 650 miles per second,
3,000 times thespeed of sound. For purposes of comparison, the fastest
manmade vehicle on earth,  the Ulysses space probe, moves at a poky 27.4
miles per second  a conventional reindeer can run, tops, 15 miles per
hour.

      4) The payload on the sleigh adds another interesting element.
Assuming that each child gets nothing more than a medium-sized Lego set
(2 pounds), the sleigh is carrying 321,300 tons, not counting Santa, who
is invariably described as overweight. On land, conventional reindeer can
pull no more than 300 pounds. Even granting that "flying reindeer" (see
point #1) could pull TEN TIMES the normal amount, we cannot do the job
with eight, or even nine. We need 214, 000 reindeer. This increases the
payload  not even counting the weight of the sleigh  to 353,430 tons.
Again, for comparison  this is four times the weight of the Queen
Elizabeth.

      5) 353,000 tons traveling at 660 miles per second creates enormous
air resistance  this will heat the reindeer up in the same fashion as
spacecrafts re-entering the earths atmosphere. The lead pair of reindeer
will absorb 14.3 QUINTILLION joules of energy. Per second. Each. In
short, they will burst into flames almost instantaneously, exposing the
reindeer behind them, and create deafening sonic booms in their wake. The
entire reindeer team will be vaporized within 4.26 thousandths of a
second. Santa meanwhile, will be subjected to centrifugal forces
17,500.06 times greater than gravity.  A 250-pound Santa (which seems
ludicrously slim) would be pinned to the back of his sleigh by 4,315,015
pounds of force.

In conclusion  if Santa ever DID deliver presents on Christmas Eve, hes
dead now.

      I still believe!!!!!!!!!!

Oh, I see.....men treated women as though they were inferior, so
we treat them as though they are inferior, and that makes it better?

Once upon a time there was a parallel universe to this one. Those who
had blue eyes were highly beautiful, intelligent, and respected. They
got paid more, were the majority of government, and were frequently
featured in the media. However, all those with any other color of eyes
were made fun of and at a great disadvantage both economically and
socially. If you had brown eyes, you would be more likely to be overly
emotional, on welfare, using drugs, etc.

Sounds pretty ridiculous doesn't it?

In my world, what people have in their underwear makes no more difference
than what color their eyes are, and I certainly don't think someone's
physical features which they have no control over should determine
their power in a culture.

I definitely do not think women should "rule"......nor men......!

imagine if you replaced the words men and women with african-american
and white. would it still sound right to you? if some people are getting the
shorter
end of the deal should they get revenge? does that solve anything?

-kim

>Name (or Nickname) = 
***SolR, solowishes [grandpaR], solomander, Ras... pookie[kid >thing,mydad] 

>What is your Age = 24, turn 25 Jan.28....
***What is your Sign = Aquarius

>Are you Single = 
***Divorced, and currently single as a middle digit.

Do you Dj = 
***no, but my interest in the music has led me to some computer software
like Rebirth which i would like to fiddle with *if* i ever get the friggin
time.

>What is your most listened to Style of Music =
***Trance,GoaTrance,Jungle,Drum&Bass

>Musician / Artist = 
***well, since i can't realy remember too many names, nor do i pay too much
attention to who is up there spinning when i am zoned in on the music... Dj
Dan has never let me down... or is this to *ask* if i'm a musician or
artist... well, yes, as a matter of fact, i like to think of myself as an
artist... do a bit of pen and ink... pencil seems to be my best medium...
although i do some computer graphics [mostly lame web stuff], including a
couple of flyers... ya know, free, cause i like my stuff to be out there,
and it gets me into the party for free... i *do* wish i had more time for
it...

>Hobbies = 
***Like to play hockey, take my dog to the river, and dance around my house
in nothing but my pants... or just smoke out and stand in front of my
stereo with my eyes closed and let the music tell me how to move... 'course
that's pretty much how i dance anyway...

>Ideal Party Linup = 
***
Someone with a buildup, Someone with a ride, Someone with a climax, Someone
with a easedown...

>Favorite Food = 
***Organic Baby greens with Basalmic vinegar, or... JackCheese, Avocado,
red onion, mustard on Orowheat HealthNut Bread... or... sautee'd homegrown
butter squash with red &green bell peppers, Mushrooms [good'uns], and
PeanutButter and Honey Sandwiches....

>Mission In Life = 
***to make enough money to support myself relatively comfortably, doing
something i love to do... 

>Favorite DJ = 
***Whoever's mix gets me dancing instead of idling.

>Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? =  
***I supose positively... i'm not quite sure what you are asking.. do i
represent to others the scene as a positive thing.. or do i contribute my
postive vibe to the scene as a collective?  both.  i think it's extremly
important for those positive persons  to contribute to the vibe... you
can't expect it to just overtake you.. you have to make your own little
contribution..

>How? = 
***by enjoying myself, dancing, smiling, skirting the promotion and
creation of parties by doing flyerart... it [theart] puts a smile on my
friend's [the promoters/producers] faces, and they are stoked about getting
it done for free i imagine...  i'm not a talkative person, nor do i offer
up hugs randomly or pass out candy, but i generally don't give off a bad
vibe...

>Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex? 
***well, i just couldn't imagine... who was it who said they go to hook up
with the music..? that was perfectly put.

peaceofmind&heart,
-SolR

Name (or Nickname)
---
jamespark (Izumi)

What is your Age
---
25

Birthday
---
September 2 1972

What is your Sign
---
Astrological: Virgo
Chinese Astrological: Rat
Element: Water

Are you Married
---
No, not yet

Have Kids
---
No, not yet

Are you Single
---
Yes

Do you DJ
---
Yes

What is your most listened to Style of Music?
---
This definitely changes. Currently it's two sides of a cassette tape:
contemporary minimalist composition for piano and other side is Italian
jungle, and whatever I happen to be spinning with that night

Musician / Artist
---
Toshio Iwai - combines music with technology
Ryuichi Sakamoto - if I could be anybody else in the world, he would be it
John Cage - our father, who art in heaven
Phillip Glass - contemporary composer extraordinaire. Einstein on the Beach
Peter Gabriel - world beat, computer technology, always interesting

Hobbies
---
Snowboarding, skateboarding, music composition, computer stuff, anime

Favorite Sexual Position
---
I'm a monk (so far)

Ideal Party Lineup
---
DJ Spooky, DJ Shadow, DJ Sho, DJ Kid Koala, Derrick May, Ken Ishii, Jeff
Mills, Joey Beltram, Mijk Van Dijk, BCJ, Hardfloor, Brother From Another
Planet

Favorite Food
---
Sushi, Risotto, Udon, Fruit!

Mission In Life
---
Get people to communicate and understand each other through music, writing,
art, and just plain talking

Favorite DJ
---
I'll state my favorite type: The kind that will talk to you if you approach
them respectfully, offer tips, tell you who else to listen to if you're
learning, or just smile and say "thank you" no matter how much
puppy-dogging people do to them, willing to try different genres or
listening to them, not dissing others without good cause. DJs who help make
the scene flow, rather than putting up roadblocks and walls. I hope I can
live up to these criteria - and more.

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively?
---
(-) - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - X - - - - (+)

How?
---
Respect for others, respect for the scene, evangelizing the positive
aspects, take people for their first times and stick with them and offer
support, remembering what is good and what is not and giving feedback,
learning all I can so I can show and tell others what a great vibe it
really is. Having a DIY attitude and making plans for, well, "doing my own
thing" for the people. San Francisco is going well now, but there is so
much potential for so much more. Let's make it happen together, shall we?

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex?
---
The music: it keeps shaking me. To me, losing the sense of hearing would be
an incredibly depressing thing. I can live w/o the sight just fine as long
as I can still hear/feel the music.

Cheers,
james

organized, co-ordinated, and
> assisted with various other sound crews to churn
out decent underground

dear raver.

   - Pablo's Sugar Shack - 
Funky House & Mad Jazzy Grooves!
      December 13, 1997

        TRACY (Mixology)

	next week: Mark Lewis (L.A.)

VSF, 278 11th St. @ Folsom, SF

 SFRaves free B4 10:30pm



** just kidding, we supplement VSF security with our own security. If
you ever have a problem such as those discussed in the recent
"VSF/STOMPY/SECURITY" thread by all means LET US KNOW! 
SugarShack@mindless.com

Otherwise, always remember that illegal behavior is still illegal
whether it's in a nightclub or not.  Believe me, the VSF security
doesn't set-up a tent and sell their confisgated goods after everybody
leaves. Several times a night the club is visited by undercover SFPD and
for security to turn their heads the other way would be to sacrifice a
space that has been very friendly to our scene (Stompy, Pablo's Sugar
Shack, Pure Space, Ultra) in a city that is becoming increasingly
after-hours intolerant.

As for mistreatment of patrons by VSF security, I personally forwarded
several of the e-mails that recently appeared on SFRaves to the owner of
VSF.  While I haven't personally witnessed any of the problems that Mr.
Lee has (I use some of my own security on my night) the owner of VSF has
told security to become less "intrusive." As for the accusations of
racism, that's a tough call.  I've never seen it, which is not to say
that it does not exist.  But when a person has admittedly had several
drinks, uses foul language, and ethnic curses, it's tough to defend
their position no matter how righteous. Security is security and a lot
of the security at VSF work at 1015, Sound Factory, 177 Townsend, and
Cat's Grill as well. On the streets you argue with a cop you're gonna
lose.  In a club you argue with a security guard you're gonna lose.
Sucks but it's true. It's best not to get into a situation like that in
the first place.  
-SUNNY

> Name (or Nickname) Rob Pointer (I hope that's not my nick name.)

> Have Kids= Nada.

> Are you Single= Nope.

> What is your most listened to Style of Music? = LTJ Bukem style Jungle, R&B based vocal house, wicked DJ Driven breakbeat (a la Dan and D. Glaude), emotional sounding techno (a la Hardkiss and FSOL, etc.)

> Musician / Artist= Yep. Editorial Graphic Design is my fav and forte.

> Hobbies= Music, Political Theory, battling the evil empire (microsoft), Urban Magazines, My company CITISCAPE, Fonts, Warez, Neville Brody, Club/party flier collecting, Finding the dangers in living w/ technology, New Media, Publishing, Apple Computer drama, Vinyl, The 49rs BABY!

> Favorite Sexual Position= If its passionate, real, communicative, and intimate then it's ALL GOOD.

> Ideal Party Linup= DJ Qbert, DJ Dan (when he's tearing it up), Hardkiss guys, DRC, Orbital, FSOL (w/ full on Multimedia Display of visuals), LTJ Bukem, Doc Scott, Chris Lum, Raymond Roker, Pete Tong, Keoki maybe, ummmm, and the opening spot? --- ME!

> Favorite Food= Chinese, Pizza, Thai Food (homemade - not the restuarant stuff - native!). I love things that are TASTY! Shoo, I'll eat anything that's got tasty flavor. 

> Mission In Life= To have a positive impact on those around me and to influence world events for the better. To drive a volvo S70 and dump my jacked honda civic that I've owned for 10 years. To meet steven jobs and have him say, "wow, you are such a visionary. I wish I had you on my team!", to create a bad-ass and fully meaningful publication that makes people think (like roling stone used to be or even how URB could be!)

don't think photoshop could help me at this point...

> Favorite DJ= Myself ('cuz I buy all the music I like which means I love everything I play.) :) It means I'm friggin' broke all the time tho.

> Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? = I don't think I really represent the scene. I just love the music, the philosophy (when one cares to rear its head), and the fact that its something we all created on OUR OWN! (I really miss the illegal days - illegal spaces, illegal samples, stuff like that...)

> How? = dy.

> Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the oposite sex? =
I don't go to hook up, but I love watching people dance and get into it. I
love the music and the energy. I really think the whole dancing thing is very
basic and primal which really leads me to believe that raving is truly sensual
when you are lost in the rhythm.

Wow. I feel free now.

jasonelee@juno.com wrote:


> Name (or Nickname)foolish fish although some just call me foolish 
or fish or both...what ever you like ...a few still call me duane
After reading these posts i think i will add grandpa fish

> What is your Age?  aquarian

> Birthday 3-13-61 (well at least its not 1861 so be quiet)

> What is your Sign= Pisces with aquarian moon and libra rising.

> Are you Married= i have venus in aries

> Have Kids= everyone is my kid...except those that arent

> Are you Single= Fish swim in schools 

> Do you Dj = I tried once but fish dont have hands so i tried using my big fish lips. I got my lips stuck on the rekkid
and found myself spinning  around and around, Dizy, i noticed
this sharp neddle and red light getting closer with each revolution.
What a way to die i thought. But luckily my human heard the commotion
and saved me and put me back in my bowl. My human is really special
by the way, she is a very charming aries. Aries women are the best.
But that is cause i have venus in aries. Venus is the planet
that tells about what you find plesurable and for men it is
often the type of women they like. So thats why im not a dj.


> What is your most listened to Style of Music? = Many, goa i thinkis my favorite and the beatles and pink floyd.

> Musician / Artist= I do airbrushing and computer art and some sculptureand other artistic things too. Life is the greatest form 
of art tho...and we are all artists in our own unique way.

> Hobbies= Astrology, astronomy, art, tantra, alternativehealing, revolutionary stuff...anything new, computers,
And camping...thats probably my favorite.


> Favorite Sexual Position= Lotus is nice although i amtrisexual so i will try anything once. Riding the cosmic waves
is probably my favorite


> Ideal Party Linup=  I dont really follow djs, and feel uncomfortablewith this idea of dj worship. So anyone that can play good
music is fine with me.

> Favorite Food= Spirulina and vegi thai

> Mission In Life= to boldy go where no one has gonebefore. To seek out and explore new ways of having fun
and then sharing them with as many as i can. 
I also want to prove that god was on some really good
drugs when she created the universe. My dream is that everyones 
dream comes true and i want to get everyone to help
each other to fulfill our dreams so we will all be happy.


> Favorite DJ= The ones that give away free mix tapes 
> Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively?  is this atrick question? I think i am a positive rep although some
look down on the fact that every full moon i climb twin peaks
strip down and smear myself with bananas and scream that raving sucks.

>DO you go to parties to hook up with opposite sex or for the music.

Bad question. There several sexes so there really is no opposite.
I have gone to a party to meet someone( havet most ppl done that at least
once?) But I go to raves to hear the music and meet people and
have fun and i find they inspire me in my art. I feel there
is a renaisance happening and raving will be a big part of that,
from new art forms to social and spiritual transformations.
New communities and so many other things as well. But
mostly just to have fun. My favorite partys are the campouts.
I really love sitting around a campfire with everyone
listening to the music and watching the stars and chatting with 
everyone about multidimensional universes and and how we are going
to make this a better world and other weird stuff.

ps thank you all who responded to my new newsletter. It is not
officially out yet and is rather sporadic. I wasnt expecting
to get nearly the response i got. I am not ignoring you, its just
going to be a few days before i get to sending everyone something.

I will be sending a forcast for the end of the year and the soltice
along with some very interesting info about what is happening
astrologically. I thank you for your patience and am very
greatful for all the interest you have shown. 

have a happy weekend.

	foolish fish

		><{{{">  <"}}}><

drum&bass + hip hop + house + dub + funk + rare grooves + soul + jazz + beatz

starter:

Jason Fluid
Specially picked oolong experimental electro, baked in soul with a generous
helping of surprise treats to tease yo tongue...

entree:

Steven Tune  ( Influx Sound System )
Sizzling Atmospheric soup, served with combination drum'n'bass Foo Young

Sang
Some Korean flava in your ear... funkungfusion of treats to end the eats...

Felix the Dog ( Black Diamond, Splendid )
Aldente (tough to the bite) - spicy, saucy, hot & tangy - prime cuts, lean
beats, and massive portions for your ears to feast on.

think what it comes down to is "what dj's don't I want to listen to?"

that.  Bad things are going to happen and your going to get pissed once in a

could have been nicer to someone, or I've forgotten to smile, but it happens.

is what will keep our scene alive.  Don't loose the enthusiasm.

wonderful person.

Musician / Artist=  Bass, piano, and drums.  Did some art in High school.

Hobbies=  Spin'n, snowboarding, mountain biking, rock climbing, Sony
playstation,
jack and coke, wine, skimming, stressing...

Favorite Sexual Position=  um...what ever the moment brings.

Ideal Party Linup=  Grooverider, Goldie, Ed Rush, Doc Scott, what the hell
all the
Drum n Bass headz! =)

Favorite Food=  Cheese and wine, Chinese, Japaness, Itlian, 

Mission In Life=  Be successful and true to myself and to the people
important in my life.

Favorite DJ=  I really don't have one cause I haven't heard all the dj's in
the world. =)

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? =  Both.

How? =  At times I get discouraged with how people can take one night of
their lives and gamble with it as if it were their last and not realize
that it can be.  On the other hand I enjoy seeing so many people in one
place enjoying themselves and not think about their worries for 7 to 9 hrs. =)

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the opposite sex? =
I go to hear the music and the quality of the spinning, to see how much
production the promoter put into it, How the promoter used the space, to
see if the people got what they paid for, to enjoy myself, to be with
friends, to meet new people....

for real.

Musician / Artist= Yup, keyboards.

Hobbies= Flying, Snow boarding, Kayaking :)

Favorite Sexual Position= VARIETY man, 69 (the Cancer symbol on it's side)
my friend...but depends on the sex of the person....a n d how P A S S I O N
A T E they are!

Ideal Party Linup= Spun, GrEg, Ethan, Dan, MarkiE, Tony, Cisko, IcEy (Oh,
too many)

Favorite Food= Italian (pasta and vino, Yum)

Mission In Life= To effect everyone I come in contact with in a positive
way, to share with others how to have a good time with this life, help
others grow individually, and to learn to love better each day.

Favorite DJ= Putting me on the spot, huh....for the moment it's Dan.

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? = Positively, it's all
good in who we are. Life is exciting because we R all different, yet we can
all party the same language :)

How? = Bringing to the scene, not only a respect, but an interest in each
person for who they are, how they are alike, and how they are different.

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the opposite sex? =
Music....to get lost in the Rhythm. That's not to say that if I really meet
someone just spaztically neat-o that I wouldn't like to know them better.

Is this the SFR dating game?@!?
Okay....I'll bite....


Name= Well....nAtAshA is just a screen name behind which there 
is a long story...

Birthday= January 26, 1972..I suppose that makes me around a 
quarter-century old

What is your Sign= Aquarius...the Eccentric of the zodiac!!

Are you Single= Yep.... rollin with the punches, enjoying every inch
of life  =)

Have Kids= hell no !!

Do you Dj= nope! I'm a spectator

Most listened to Style of Music = hmmm, i have real picky tastes...psy trance,
progressive house or trippy dance with lots of airy funkadelic layers and
headsplitting beats that you  *can't* stand still to !!  does that cover it?!
none of that over-played kinda house you find in cheezzzy clubby dives 
It's all about Energie!!!

Musician / DJ = dj dan always seems to hit the spot....anything high-
energy (sorta fits my personality??) just *give me energie@!!!*...any 
of those big time LA stars who rocked my world for 2years ...
Orbital and FSOL and the Crystal Method are kewl too

Hobbies= Gee, what *don't* I do?!?  my life is my hobby lately =P
let's see...mycology, eastern philosophy, yoga, reptiles (I have a boa,
Ursula ) hikes & nature adventures, glow-in-the-dark stars, exercise, 
medicinal and neurological chemistry (told ya this might get messy =D ), 
family, music, laughter, love, happiness, friendship! 

Favorite Sexual Position= hahaha  hell, i do yoga, i can make anything
interesting =P  it's ALL good

Ideal Party Lineup= I don't care if the pope is spinning, if he shredds the
place up!!   I'm all about the time, space, who you go with......you can hear
the same dj two nights in a row & he might suck one time and send you into
oblivion the next...so who knows which it'll be?  

Favorite Food= frozen yogurt....spicy curried tear-jerking vegetarian
concoctions (yes, I'm a rabbit).. sushi...no red meat 

Mission In Life= Be the most unique me I can be!! And make sure
everybody gets infected with my laughter and happy smiles!  
Oh, yeah, and i'm one of those chemical researcher nerdy types who's
interested in the parkinson's conundrum and related biological 
imperfections...so who knows -- some of the most amazing scientific 
discoveries often happen by chance :)

Favorite DJ= Dan! & anybody who can send me to the next galaxy in 8 hrs or
less

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively? How?= Well, I only moved
up here 6 months or so ago, but I'd think that anyone who's met me would
vouch that i'm a pretty insanely happy person. So i guess that would be a good
thing, yes?  I think life is about helping yourself and others to be the most
incredible, dynamic people they can be.  To quote myself, "Nobody loses the
race if we all finish together !"  Humanity, compassion, connection,
exploration- what else is there??  

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the opposite sex? 
DEFINITELY for the music...meeting people is just part of the package =D

luv n hugs n post-final-exams BLISS,
natasha

				are like in person.  Maybe I'll get a chance soon.
Music or Sex?=			I go to have a good time.  So far it's only been the music.
				I won't rule out the idea of love or sex.  I'd prefer friendship.
				Sex is scary.  There is a lot of trust in sharing body fluids!

Your Jedi Bitch,

> 
> i thought i knew a lot about indian music, but i'm stumped on this
> one.  what's shabad music?

Shabad music is sikh hymns, they are teachings and poems taken out of the
Siri Guru Granth (the bible of the sikhs).  They are sung in Gurumukhi
(closely related to Punjabi) and are played to the accompaniment of
harmoniums and tablas.  Regardless if you are sikh or spiritual the music
itself is beautiful!

> 
> self taught?  damn!  tablas are really hard to play yall, super finger
> finesse is required - major props!
>
Thanks! :) 
> 
> live technotabla?  woah!  let us know if it happens, gotta hear that! 
> hey, do you ever listen to bhangra?  billy sagoo?  dj majic mike (ny
> not miami)?  what about this new stuff like talvin singh (sp?) if so,
> any reccomendations in that genre?
> 
I will let you know, you can download kdvs off of real radio,
unfortunately my show will be from 3-6 in the morning for a quarter (the
shit spot they give newbies.) but i will give you times and dates.  I used
to bhangra dance when i lived in india, we also have bangra competitions
here in davis and a couple of dj's who spin techno bangra music, it is
alot of fun.  Talvin Singh has done some amazing mixing of traditional
hindustani music syles and D&B I think that it is a good diverse branch of
techno and hope more ethnic off shoots spin off from it (no pun intended.)
I have some bootleg goa stuff that is incredible!

tabs

i wrote:
>>> Mission In Life= to make the world better through technology.


then Lady Linz wrote:
>OUCH! Do you really think that the world could get any better through
>the use of technology? I mean, shit, our technology is surpassing our
>humanity! Technology is creating a huge division in our society that
>will not be able to be fixed. I think that most of our problems today
>can be attributed to the technological advances of the 20th century, and
>it makes me sick. If we're going to make our world better, we need to
>focus on PEOPLE, not  TECHNOLOGY!

this could easily become a war, so i'll try to just present the reasoning
behind my above response and leave it at that... let me give some examples
of the ways i think that the world is made better through technology: my
life span is now about double what it was before modern medicine. i can call
my mom on the phone and, even though i'm 3000 miles away, hear her voice. i
can access information in libraries, encyclopedias, and academic journals
all over the world from my computer. i can listen to TECHNO on a huge sound
system.

in my mind, part of what it means to be human is to learn to use and improve
the tools we have, be that a simple stone tied to a stick or a
supercomputer. of course there are many issues that deal with the
responsible and beneficial USE of these tools, but decrying the advance of
technology is not only misguided but nonproductive. if you feel we need to
focus on people, then do so. but attacking technology as the source of our
modern problems is foolish. we can never unlearn what we learn as a species,
we can never return to the days of the past, as quaint as they might seem.
we must accept inevitable progress and do our best to use what we learn and
create to improve our world. which returns me to my mission in life...

. . . . . . .
ben_chun@community.net
ben_chun@technologist.com

www.community.net/~ben_chun/

  Mannnnnnnnn, it made me soooo  MAD today when I picked up my school
newspaper.  In one of the articles something on what to do in Fremont when you
are bored the last three things to do were listed as these raves coming
up....CANDYLAND, BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE & ACID BREAKS 2!!!!  These were listed along
with the Djs spinning, date, presented by so and so and the PHONE NUMBERS to
call for info!!!  All this after the other things to do such as going to the
Edge, the X, etc.  Not that I don't like those other things to do, just that I
don't think that they all belong together in my school newspaper.   It might
just be me, but I don't think that raves should be publicized in High School
Newspapers or newspapers period.  Then it attracts all the people that have
never even been to raves and the people that go just to go, cause they have
nothing better to do & then proceed to completly trash our scene while there
because we are all a bunch of "freaks 'n wierdos" that listen to crappy music.
( Not that new people to the scene are bad)

Okay time for me to go flame me now if you like but you shall never flake me
to pieces, I really don't feel like going any further and I think yall get the
idea.  Just remember if you flame me send it to ravalum@pacbell.net, not
Patrice at this addy.

Teresa, and now here is Patrice.

*DISCLAIMER*(from the tekno diva)  AHEM.. I had no part in writing this letter
(guilty look) Uh.. but I do have a few points to make as long as this is
coming from my address.  Yanno.. kill two birds with one stone or stone two
newbies with a.. whatever.  Alrite... first off...  It makes me pretty mad to
hear that a school, (and my rival school at that =)  Is being informed of all
these parties in this way.  Personally, I've been trying to get new people
involved in the scene.. but it should be done in a way that conveys what makes
it special to us.  I think that just putting the number in your school
newspaper is right up there with being a chronic name dropper.  Ok, sure, It
makes you feel pretty damn special, and a few people may enjoy thinking
they'll get closer to those people by being your friend, but to the rest of us
it is JUST PLAIN ANNOYING.  GRRR.. I am FURIOUS!! Go ahead.. flame me.  I can
take it once in a while since I hardly ever get mad.  Plus.. if I was throwing
a party.. such as Beautiful people... and someone started tossing my info line
around to people that are most likely going to bring a bad vibe with them, i'd
be upset.  I understand that with bigger parties you want to spread the word,
but even then it should be a bit more friendly than this.   Get ready for a
hoarde of fashion ravers pouring into these three parties.  DOn't expect to
see me there.  I love you all.. if yer gonna dissagree with me.. don't be too
harsh.  JUST MY OWN OPINION....

      hugs n'stuff,
         'trice the tekno diva

See what happens when you let us have unlimited use of the computer when we
get mad??  

   "IF YOU'RE GOING TO GET IN TROUBLE... AT LEAST ENJOY IT."

everywhere for these parties (both smaller and larger)?

> Patrice at this addy.

> newbies with a.. whatever.  Alrite... first off...  It makes me pretty mad to
> hear that a school, (and my rival school at that =)  Is being informed of all
> these parties in this way.  Personally, I've been trying to get new people
> involved in the scene.. but it should be done in a way that conveys what makes
> it special to us.  I think that just putting the number in your school
> newspaper is right up there with being a chronic name dropper.  Ok, sure, It
> makes you feel pretty damn special, and a few people may enjoy thinking
> they'll get closer to those people by being your friend, but to the rest of us
> it is JUST PLAIN ANNOYING.  GRRR.. I am FURIOUS!! Go ahead.. flame me.  I can
> take it once in a while since I hardly ever get mad.  Plus.. if I was throwing
> a party.. such as Beautiful people... and someone started tossing my info line
> around to people that are most likely going to bring a bad vibe with them, i'd
> be upset.  I understand that with bigger parties you want to spread the word,
> but even then it should be a bit more friendly than this.   Get ready for a
> hoarde of fashion ravers pouring into these three parties.  DOn't expect to
> see me there.  I love you all.. if yer gonna dissagree with me.. don't be too

On Sat, 13 Dec 1997, b e n   c h u n wrote:

> this could easily become a war, so i'll try to just present the reasoning
> behind my above response and leave it at that... let me give some examples
> of the ways i think that the world is made better through technology: my
> life span is now about double what it was before modern medicine. i can call
> my mom on the phone and, even though i'm 3000 miles away, hear her voice. i
> can access information in libraries, encyclopedias, and academic journals
> all over the world from my computer. i can listen to TECHNO on a huge sound
> system.

However in order to present a "balanced" view, you need to include the
other side of the issue as to where "technology" has gotten us:

Pollution, the rapid depletion of natural resources, increasing invasions
of privacy, the ability to wipe out all life on earth with the push of a
button, and the list goes on. 

Technology has it's uses. But like most other things, it is not
intrinsicly good or bad. It is all a matter of application....

					Black Adder

>On Fri, 12 Dec 1997, Jungle Diva wrote:
>
>>
>>
>>
>> >> Mission In Life= to make the world better through technology.
>>
>> OUCH! Do you really think that the world could get any better through
>> the use of technology? I mean, shit, our technology is surpassing our
>> humanity! Technology is creating a huge division in our society that
>> will not be able to be fixed. I think that most of our problems today
>> can be attributed to the technological advances of the 20th century, and
>> it makes me sick. If we're going to make our world better, we need to
>> focus on PEOPLE, not  TECHNOLOGY! (I just thought that needed to be
>> said...)
>> Lady Linz*
>>

Technology is a tool and like any other tool, it's use is determined by the
user.  Most anything in the world cn be used positively AND negatively.  It
is up to us to make sure that technology is used in a positive way.  It is
possible.  If tech is used negatively, do not blame the technology but
rather, the individuals and organizations who are implementing it as such.
Megan

blkadder said:
>However in order to present a "balanced" view, you need to include the
>other side of the issue as to where "technology" has gotten us:
>
>Pollution, the rapid depletion of natural resources, increasing invasions
>of privacy, the ability to wipe out all life on earth with the push of a
>button, and the list goes on.
>
>Technology has it's uses. But like most other things, it is not
>intrinsicly good or bad. It is all a matter of application....

good analysis. i think that's about where i stand on it as well. tools have
no intrinsic good or evil. for me to say my mission in life is to make the
world better through technology means that i want to try to do something to
fix the bad things we have created in trade-off for the good things we've
gotten.

doreen had another good point:
>our generation is going to be
>the first to realize that hey, maybe i DON'T want to live to a
>hundred, ya know?  cuz that's a LONG fucking time.

we do have to consider if the world what we are creating is truly what we
want. and of course we need to be open to all the sides, not blind
techno-boosters. which i don't really consider myself. but since i don't
believe in retreating from knowledge, however dangerous, i would say that
this quote from noam chomsky pretty well sums up my thoughts on the matter:

"Optimism is a strategy for making a better future. Beacuse unless
you believe that the future will be better, it's unlikely that you will step
up and take responsibility for making it so. If you assume that there's no
hope, you guarantee that there will be no hope. If you assume that there is
an instince for freedom, there are opportunities to change things, there's a
chance that you may contribute to making a better world. The choice is
yours."


. . . . . . .
ben_chun@community.net
ben_chun@technologist.com

www.community.net/~ben_chun/

To: SFRaves@hyperreal.org, "'TeKnODiVa'" <TeKnODiVa@aol.com>
Subject: RE: KRR:  Stick in the Mud
Date: Sat, 13 Dec 1997 11:14:33 -0800
X-Priority: 3
MIME-Version: 1.0
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.0.1458.49)
Content-Type: text/plain
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

I've met every great partner i've ever had through activities that I
love, or through other great friends.  The two women with whom I had the
deepest relationships, I met through theatre.  One of those was a friend
of a friend.  I've met none of them while I've been looking for someone.
It seems that the harder I look, the less I find.  Then, it seems
everytime, I give up on finding someone, and then a wonderful person
appears.  This has been a faithful pattern over 17 years of
relationships, so i don't think any of it is coincidental.

I think key element here is related to  "You can't truly love someone
else, till you truly love yourself."  I think what happens is I start
doing things I love, fulfilling myself.  At that point, people are truly
able to see some of your personality.  And especially for people like
me:  i'm not the type of person people look at and immediately love/lust
after.  Only after truly getting to know some of the deeper insides of
me do people love me.

So, the upshot of all this is that "pickup" places for me are virtual
places.  My hobbies.  My art.  My friends.  The "pickup" place that
never works for me is exactly that:  when I try to pickup someone, it
either fails miserably, or I have a bad relationship.

whata do?  be yourself.  do things you love.  if you can, stop worrying
about it (kinda hard to do, sometimes).  you'll meet people who like you
for what you are.  relationships follow life, then life follows your
relationships.

dodger

Subject: Re: Tell US about yourself

 Well, why not.


Name?
 Giles (sounds like "Jy-ulz")
 
What is your Age?
 23, the magic number - the Earth's axis is at a 23-degree angle to the
sun's axis, the heart's axis is at a 23-degree angle to the body's axis,
the number of chromosomes in human DNA is 23, etc.

Birthday?
 3/7/74
 
What is your Sign?
 Pisces with Aquarius rising.
 
Are you Married?
 No.

Have Kids?
 No, but kids are the BOMB. Remember what it was like to be a kid? 
Everything was new and amazing. I think when you can go back into what it
was like when you were a kid, and experience those sensations all over
again, it's like everything in the world becomes new for you, and you get
to see the world in a fantastic light. 
 
Are you Single?
 Yep.
 
Do you Dj?
 No, altho I do create tracks at home. They range in style. I make a lot
of hip-hop, and I used to make a lot of jazzy, spacy techno. I used to
freestyle with my brother, too.

What is your most listened to Style of Music?
 Jungle, hip-hop, house (the deeper the better).

Musician / Artist?
 Both. I make tracks, I do design, and I'm working on a screenplay about
alien abduction.

Hobbies?
 Music, typography, design, writing, of course having sex, mountain
biking, and I used to ski a little, but this winter I'm learning to
snowboard.

Favorite Sexual Position?
 My position on sex is that sex is a very good thing. I encourage
everybody reading this to go and have sex right now. With me, my position
is that I think sex is all good - sometimes it's just fun, sometimes it's
this fantastically intense experience of connection, but it always beats
just sitting around watching TV, you know?

Favorite Food?
 Italian, no doubt. I love the way the spices can complement the food.

Mission In Life?
 (see favorite sexual position)

 Seriously...think about your life for a second. You know how there are so
many things in your life that you've thought about doing, crazy shit that
you've wanted to try? My goal in life right now is to make those things
happen. 1996 was really weird for me - a couple people died who were very
close, one who was very young to boot, and my father came close to dying
too - and it just really made me realize that you have to take advantage
of the time you have while it's still there.
  One thing I did is make a list of all the things I wanted to do. One of
them is getting my tattoo, which I'm doing on Jan. 3rd (thanks to all who
gave me advice on where to find a good tattoo place, btw - have a look at
http://www.bowkett.com/tattoo if you want to see the design I'm getting). 
Another is learning to snowboard, which I've got planned, and another is
swimming with dolphins. There's a place in the Bahamas which is a dolphin
swim camp. You go there for a week or a weekend, and you get to swim with
the dolphins. Imagine what it would be like to swim with dolphins. With
me, I think something like that is just so amazing.

Do you represent the Scene Negatively or Positively?
 I don't know what I represent to other people, but I know that when you
go inside and look for what matters to you, and see a chance to experience
it, that, with me, is definitely positive.
  What the hell has that got to do with the scene? I don't know, my mind
is sorta wandering.
 
How?
 How is my mind wandering? ;-) From topic to topic, basically. In the way
that your mind does when you're getting really interested in something.

Do you go to parties to hear the music or hook up with the opposite sex?
 Well, to be perfectly honest, some raver girls are hella fine, so it's
not like I'm not looking, but it's more about the music.


   --------]                   [--------
     ------] giles@bowkett.com [------
       ----]                   [----

-->What are you talking about?  Of course it's possible...Santa lives in
another dimension that is connected to ours only during certain times of
our Gregorian year; X-mas being one of them.  In Mr. Claus's dimension
elves, dwarves, and munchkins are "employed" by Santa to work in low
paying 60h/wk shifts to create cottage crafts to distribute as signs of
good will.This is because Claus is one of the many autonomous despots
(see_Wiz of Oz_ and _Alice in W-Lnd_ as reference) in the region and was
appointed as Ambassador of Positive Thinking and Empathy Between
Discontinuous Regions of The Universal Connundrum Dimensions Three and
Five (see Proceeds of the MMCXXIVth Annual Appointment Process for the
Ambassador of Positive Thinking and Empathy Between Discontinous Regions
of the Universal Connundrum Dimensions Three and Five, United Regions of
Dimension Five Government Press, Emerald City--Oz, 34758BN as reference).
Flying Reindeers come a dime a dozen in the D-5 existence but so are
many other Animals (see aforementioned references) which are experiencing
a displacement of rights because humanoids want to reduce them to the
lowely animals instead of the free-thinkingly intelligent talking Animals
that they are (see _Wicked_). The existence of intelligent Animals has
been well documented (Milne's _Pooh_ series, Grimm, Andersen, Bechstein,
Hauff, Kaestner, et al), thus providing a basis for comparison and
establishing  undeniable documentation for the  existential conscious
condition of Animals over the years.=20
=09Newtonian physics is not as all encompassing in D-5 as in D-3 and
the absence of traditional physical laws in the D-3 world are common.
There is also a big time displacement between the two worlds (approx.
40 minutes to 120 years depending upon locality; the most extreme cases in
the land of Faerie which is classified as D-4.5 and goverened by another
set of laws completely).  The time displacement is well used by Mr. Claus,
who travels back and forth betweeen the two worlds, to his advantage
during delivery time at X-mas.
=09The existence of D-5 is difficult to prove for residents of D-3,
but since children and animals are much more sensitive to displacements,
the majority of D-3 have had some contact with D-5 in their youth
(see Dorothy and Toto)--with some rare documented cases experienced within
the thresholds of adulthood as well (see Oracle of Apollo, Amerid rites of
passage, hallucinogen drugs, etc. as related topics).  =20
=09Much work has been done to try and discredit the existence of D-5
by top D-3 in the annals of psychoanalysis and science, but the truly
informed residents of D-3 are much more resistant to such government
sposored attempts at cover-up and propaganda; which reach an all-time high
during the months of X-mas, Midsummer's, and Hallow's Eve.


:)
M&m=20

> only Santa has ever       seen.
>=20
>       2) There are 2 billion children (persons under 18) in the world.
> But since Santa
>       doesn=92t appear to handle the Muslim, Hindu, Jewish and Buddhist
> children, that
>       reduces the workload to 15% of the total - 378 million according to
> Population
>       Reference Bureau. At an average (census) rate of 3.5 children per
> household,       that=92s 91.8 million homes. One presumes there=92s at l=
east
> one good child in each.
>=20
>       3) Santa has 31 hours of Christmas to work with, thanks to the
> difference time       zonesand the rotation of the earth, assuming he
> travels east to west (which             seems logical).  This works out
> to 822.6 visits per second. This is to say that for each
> Christianhousehold with good children, Santa has 1/1000th of a second to
> park, hop out of the sleigh, jump down the chimney, fill the stockings,
> distribute the remaining presents under the tree, eat whatever snacks
> have been left, get back up the chimney, get back into the sleigh and
> move on to the next house. Assuming that each of these 91.8 million stops
> are evenly distributed around the earth (which, of course, we know to be
> false but for the purposes of our calculations we will accept), we are
> now talking about .78 miles per household, a total trip of 75-1/2 million
> miles, not counting stops to do what most of us must do at least once
> every 31 hours, plus feeding and etc.
>=20
>       This means that Santa=92s sleigh is moving at 650 miles per second,
> 3,000 times thespeed of sound. For purposes of comparison, the fastest
> manmade vehicle on earth,  the Ulysses space probe, moves at a poky 27.4
> miles per second =96 a conventional reindeer can run, tops, 15 miles per
> hour.
>=20
>       4) The payload on the sleigh adds another interesting element.
> Assuming that each child gets nothing more than a medium-sized Lego set
> (2 pounds), the sleigh is carrying 321,300 tons, not counting Santa, who
> is invariably described as overweight. On land, conventional reindeer can
> pull no more than 300 pounds. Even granting that "flying reindeer" (see
> point #1) could pull TEN TIMES the normal amount, we cannot do the job
> with eight, or even nine. We need 214, 000 reindeer. This increases the
> payload =96 not even counting the weight of the sleigh =96 to 353,430 ton=
s.
> Again, for comparison =96 this is four times the weight of the Queen
> Elizabeth.
>=20
>       5) 353,000 tons traveling at 660 miles per second creates enormous
> air resistance =96 this will heat the reindeer up in the same fashion as
> spacecrafts re-entering the earth=92s atmosphere. The lead pair of reinde=
er
> will absorb 14.3 QUINTILLION joules of energy. Per second. Each. In
> short, they will burst into flames almost instantaneously, exposing the
> reindeer behind them, and create deafening sonic booms in their wake. The
> entire reindeer team will be vaporized within 4.26 thousandths of a
> second. Santa meanwhile, will be subjected to centrifugal forces
> 17,500.06 times greater than gravity.  A 250-pound Santa (which seems
> ludicrously slim) would be pinned to the back of his sleigh by 4,315,015
> pounds of force.
>=20
> In conclusion =96 if Santa ever DID deliver presents on Christmas Eve, he=
=92s
> dead now.
>=20

--> Err, this is will sound kinda lame, but I will try to reply to a
message from C. Porter concerning this post, but since I accidentaly
deleted it...

...there seems to be some miscommunication here (since most of sfraves is
written and not spoken, this is understandable).  I was not flaming you, I
was implying that other women might be offended by your thought that only
MAN-sized women are able to hold power; which in a sense, discredits them
as women.

...if I was out to flame you, there would be no mistake about it.  I
thought that the format of my response was rather staid and did not
contain much in the form of insult, thus indicating it as a discussion and
not a flame.  Of course, I was mistaken to assume so; thus this
clarification. 

...I am not offended by your flame because I see it as a mistake and
rather misdirected.  Before you jump on me again, don't be so
hyper-sensitive about what you read on the net...discussion is discussion
and because you read something that is offensive, you shouldn't scream at
the poster instantaneously; would you do that in a real discussion with
actual living people present? Just because something is put to print does
not necessarily mean that it has meaning or significance, be sure to read
between the lines sometimes.

...if you would be so kind as to send me your previous flame, I would be
more prepared to answer it thoroughly.


:)
M&m







On Thu, 11 Dec 1997, Minh Q. Le wrote:

> 
> 
> On Thu, 11 Dec 1997, Christopher Porter wrote:
> 
> > Seriously, my girlfriend has an interesting observation:  All the 
> traditional matriarchal societies (that we could think of) occurred 
> among peoples that had... well... MAN sized women.  
> 
> -->Boy, you're gonna get blasted for that comment.
> 
> >Samoans, Hawaiians, some Native Americans, women of these societies 
> >are certainly not frail in appearance, nor lacking in physical stature.
>  > No offence to these people, my girlfriend's family tree has both Samoan
> > and Hawaiian roots, and I have Cherokee grandparents.  Contrast that 
> >with European women... Viking Babes (humor) notwithstanding, generally 
> >not as imposing size wise.  Hmmm.... 
> > 
> 
> 
> -->I don't think I agree with your observation;  there have been numerous
> examples of matriarchial societies in the past and I don't think I was
> especially struck by the robust stature of the women. Since the accepted
> theory states that Amerids migrated from Asia via an icy land bridge, and
> human colonization of Pacific Islands originated from Southeast Asia there
> is a possible suggestion of strong matriarchial antecedents passed on from
> the Asian continent.  Samoans, Hawaiians, and Amerids display impressive
> physical characteristics because both sexes lead an existance close to the
> land and nature which dictates an active physical lifestyle.  I don't
> think the women of these cultures are arguably bigger than their male
> counterparts per say, but if you do a physical comparison of these women
> with Japanese, German, and Peruvian women of course you are going to see
> morphological differences since these people live in differing
> environments. True, European women in the middle ages were forced indoors
> to do embroidery, Japanese women were cosetted into doll-like
> configurations, and Peruvian women into weaving textiles; these are faulty
> arguments since they only apply to certain socially striated classes that
> are not representative of the whole cross-section.
> 	Besides that, political power is quite distinct from physical
> power and the fact that males tend to be physically stronger than females
> is an undeniable factor that needs to be considered into such arguments.
> There are examples of matriarchial lines in various Amazonian and African
> tribes and when many of these subsistence cultures are examined,
> traditional gender roles are present, but there also tend to be separate
> spheres of power wielded only by males over other males and women over
> other women (which kinda reminds me of "secret" male societies in western
> culture, e.g. Promisekeepers, Masons, Robert Blythe inspired bongo beaters,
>  women's tupper and society parties, collegiate greek systems, etc.). And
> like much in politics, much has to do with symbolism, and even though clan
> leadership might be passed down to a sister's daughter, the real power
> might reside within the male dominated circle of elders.  
> 
> 	But my point is, I don't think the size of a woman is any
> indication of her strength and "woman-ness". Thinking so is not only
> dangerous and presumptous in the size-ist sense, but she might just kick
> your ass before you know it. 
> 
> 
> 	Oh, and I also wanted to add to Mr N'Stuff's thread: Interracial
> crossing is very good in the biological and cultural exchange sense; too
> bad social mores are still so primitive.
> 
> 
> :)
> J'rambling,
> M&m
>  
> 
>

At 10:38 AM -0800 12/13/96, Doreen wrote:
>> my
>> life span is now about double what it was before modern medicine.
>
>hmm...i'm going to sound very hypocritical (beleive me, i'm glad i
>didn't die of scarletina when i was 8 thanks to medicine) but somebody
>told me this once, can't remember who it was, but he was definately a
>ravEr, said something to the point that our generation is going to be
>the first to realize that hey, maybe i DON'T want to live to a
>hundred, ya know?  cuz that's a LONG fucking time.
>also, another idea to support this: it's better to burn out than to
>fade away.
>flames private please, i don't wanna recreate the havoc of the sexism
>thing .
>
>doreen

100 years is in no way a long time.  I have so many things I'd like to do
in life, I don't feel like I'll have enough time to do them all.  I don't
buy into the idea that growing older means losing the capabilty or desire
to live.  Time is a gift and I intend to use and enjoy every damn bit of
it.  If any of you don't, I think it's too bad that you can't give that
time to another who would appreciate some extra time spent on this earth.

The experiences I will have in my later years will in no way be the same os
those of my younger years and that is exactly why I am looking foward to
them.  Change is difficult but it is also what feeds the soul.

Bring it on!
Megan
